Ekore a te Tiati e pai ko ia hei kai whakawa i runga i ta tatou ritenga. Kua tae atu hoki tana pukapuka kia koutou. Heoi, kua ki maua inaiauei ma te kooti whenua e mahi, me kawe auo te whakawa ki Rangitikei, penei me te whakawa ki Whanganui, ki Wairarapa, ki Poneke. Na ma taua Kooti e rapu nga wahi o te pupuri whenua i Rangitikei puta noa ki Orona ki Manawatu. Ko ta maua whakaaro tenei, na kua whakane a Te Retimaua ratou ko ona hoa Minita. He whakaatu noa atu tenei naku ki;t mohio ai koutou. Ka mutu na to koutou hoa. NA TE PrRA. Kia Takaua, Kia Te Ara, Kia Hoeta, Kia Karihana.

speaker: The Hon. Sir APIRANA NGATA (Eastern Maori District)

speaker: The Hon. Sir APIRANA NGATA
text: Te Reinga, " Hepetema n, 1937. Ki te Kai-rehita, " Kooti Whenua Maori, " Kihipane. E hoa tena koe ara koutou katoa. Ma te mahana o te whiti o te ra o te raumati e paneke mai nei e whakaheke te toto matao e rere nei i roto i nga manawa o nga mana. Kua tae mai to reta, a kanui taku pouri. E ki ana nga pakeke, tenei mea te wa he mutungakore. Ahakoa ra, tera ranei e roa atu i a koutou e whiriwhiri nei i o matou hiahia? He tokonga ake no te ngakau miharo i te rongonga i nga kauhou a te Minita i a ia i ruke ai i ana whakamarama mo nga wa o nehera, me tana whakatupato ano mo nga ra kei te heke iho; koia ahau i rere ai, kei te mohio koe, ki te tuku tono hanga whare. Ka taha tena ra me ahau ano kite tatari; a i ahau e i tatari ana ka rotua e te moe a i ahau e moe ana moe rawa iho ko ahau i te purei hoiho i te Wairoa i roto i tetahi peke tipara. Ka whiti ahau he taiapa e tu mai ana he taiapa ke, e tu mai ana he taiapa ke, e tn mai ana he taiapa ke, ko ia taiapa i teitei ake i to mua atu. Ka tutuki i ahau te rauna tuatahi ka rongo ahau i te reo e karanga ana, 'karangatia atu te Maori karangatia atu te Maori kia kaati kia uiuia e tatou orui ahuatanga motuhake. I runga i taku pouri me taku kino mo te korenga i tukua kia tutuki i ahau taua oma, oho tonu atu ahau: no reira taukuri e te mamae i ahau mo tt whatinga o taku moe. No reira ka whati nei nga whakaaturanga a nga atua o te po. Anei noa he whakamarama maku mo taku tono whare. Ki te kore he whero o ton tarau ehara ianei tena i te ahuatanga motuhake e tika ai kia meatia he mea hou? Na reira e hoa kaore ra he uhi o taku kanukanu whare teneti; otiia ma te Atua koe e manaaki e tohu hoki kia tae mai ra ano ia koe he whare hou moku. Heoi ano na to hoa. Rangi Karaitiana.

speaker: The Hon. Sir APIRANA NGATA
text: Ka nukunuku! Ka nekeneke! A ha ha! Kia kite au i te tai o te uru, Kia kite au i te tai o Poneke, £ haruru mai nei na! Au, au, au e ha! Hei! E koro, e Wcpu, e! Ka horo! E! Ka horo! E! A ha ha! Ka horo ra te Tiriti o Waitangi, Ka horo! Hei! A ha ha! Na te Kawana Kaimahi pea? E rona ra i nga ture, K apo ra i nga moni, K muru ra i te whenua, Ka tangi au, au, au e ha! Kaore hoki te rongo o te ture paohinu e, Tukituki ana i te Kawhiti! A ha ha I I topea mai i roto o Poneke, I topea mai i roto o Poneke, Ka noho au ka ngeteugete, Ka tu au ka tirotiro, E ki te Pirimia kuputaka o Niu Tireni, 1 aue . i kei whea? E koro, e Wepu e me o huruhuru, me o Kamupcne hamupaka e! E i aha tera e! E kiki ra to waewac, Ki te Tiriti o Waitangi, E kiki ra to waewae Ki te Tiriti o Waitangi, Kia puta kiwaho ra, O to ana raiona I Poneke ra, A whakairi rawa koe Ki nga pakitara o le whare o nga ture, Hei tipare whakaheke toto koa! A ha ha! Mau e ki mai, e Wepu, I say Maori, Ina te kohuretanga, Ina te kohiwatanga, Anei te pohanetanga, I aue, hel!

speaker: Mr. TIRIKATENE (Southern Maori District)
text: There is a Maori phrase, Na Ihowa i homai; na Ihowa i tango atu; kia whakapaingia te ingoa o Ihowa—

speaker: Mr. T I R I K A T E N E (Southern Maori District)
text: E le Honore Pika, me nga honore mema o te Whare Paremata, me te iwi nui toiiu, nut alu nga mihi, mo tenei wahangakua tukua mat ki nga mema, hei mihinga ki nga hoa mema kua rupeke atu ki tua o te arai ki te wahangutanga o te tangata. Koia, i runga i tenei kaupapa, me korero te whakaaro, ka ca nga tangi. Haere e koro, e Taite; haere i runga i te ara whanui; haere i runga i te huarahi ki te rangatiratanga o te Rangi. Waiho mat o mahi papai hei pounamu whakamaharatanga ki tenei ao.

Tena houtou te hunga ora, tena houtou nga Toa A Tu, atatou tamarihi Hoia, hia nui nga manaahitanga a otatou Arihi hi runga i a houtou, nga Toa A Tu hi te riri, tatu iho mai hi nga tamarihi e whahatiha nei i a ratou hia tu hi mua i te hoa riri. Kaati, e Aotearoa, te Waipounamu me Wharehauri, ho lahu pouri ho nga horero ha whai ahe nei, me horerotia i te reo paheha. Hei honei ra e te Iwi.

text: Paraire Karaka Paikea was born in 1893 at Otamatea, Kaipara.

text: Moe max ra e pa, moe max i roto i a Hinepapa. Moe mai i roto i te hopu o te whemta ara i roto i te moutere e tit nei i waenganui i Ka1para raua ho te Moana Nui-a-Kiwa. Tahoto mai, whaharongo hi te tangi me te papahi o nga ngaru o nga moana e rua i roto i nga maharatanga moa.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: E nga iwi e nga reo o te tai-tokerau Una kontou i le ahuatanga io tatou aitua. Ki nga maatua, ki nga whaea, kinga wahine me nga kotiro a nga koia i nga mea kua mate i nga mea kua tu-a-kiko me tangi tahi tatou I tenei po. E taku matua e toko tena koe me to tatou whaea me te puhi e noho mai na i mua i nga oneone 0 tatou maatua e takolo na i to tatou temepara. Ko ahau tenei ko te rito-o-piri wiri tua Paikea kua tu nei ki tana turanga i roto i tenei ra e korero atu nei. Noreira tena koutou katoa.

speaker: Mr. OMAN A
text: E nga Iwi, e nga Rco. Aotearca, Waipounamu, Wharekauri, tena koutou i tc ahuatanga o tatau aitua, hui atu ki a tatau tamariki i te. pae o tc pahanga. Tend matau a koutou tamariki i roto i te IV hare ka maln i nga maln hei painga >no talau mo te iwi Maori. Ma te Ariki, Matua Tama, Wairua Tapu, me nga Anahera pono, e homai te Maramatanga, ma te Manga: tau toko, ake.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: He mihi \enei ki te Iwi Maori o Aotearoa, Te Waipounamu whiti atu ki Whare Kauri, toe atu ki o tatou tamariki, nga Toa a Tu ki te riri, tena Koutou me o tatou mate, Ka huri nga mihi ki te hunga ora, tena Koutou, tena tatou Katoa, ko te aroha te me nui o nga mea Katoa. Kaati nga mihi. Hei konei ra.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: E Nga Iwi enga Reo, enga Hapu o nga hau e \fha tena Koutou tena Koulou i te ahuatanga io tatou Aitua puta noa Te Motu, a, toe atu hoki ki te Whanau a Tu-Matauenga e Noho mai ra e hinga mai ra i te Mura o te A hi. E Toko tena koe me to Whanau me to taua Whaea me te Puhi menga Morehu e noho mai na i to tatou Pa, i mua ano hoki i to tatou Temepara me nga Oneone o tatou Maatua.

speaker: Mr. OMANA
text: Tena koutou E nga iwi ote motu, iroto i nga manaakitanga ate Matua, ate Tama, ate Wairua Tapu, me nga Anahera Pono, mete Mangai hei Tautoko. Ae. Tenet matau a koutou tamariki, e noho atu nei iroto ite Whare Paremata, e tangi atu nei ki o tatau Aitua ote Motu, hui atu ki a tatau tamariki, e hinga mai ra ite pae ote pakanga. E koa ana te ngakau, mo nga nu o te pakanga, kote tumanako, kia tere te mutu, kia hoki mai a tatau tamariki kite wa kainga, hui atu koki ki o tatau hoa pakeha. Kote tenei o nga wiki, e korero ana nga mema o te Whare, mote ahua o nga moni, kua wharitea mo nga mahi ote motu, toe atu ki nga taumahatanga ote pakanga, iroto itenei tekau ma rua marama e tu mai nei. Noreira kua tata te mutu Kote korero mo nga whenua Raupatu kei te tu tonu, kote wawata o tenei Kawanatanga kia tika, kia oli koki tenet Take i roto i nga ra tata e tu mat nei. Tena hoe e Toko e noho mai na iroto i to tatau Pa, kia piki Te ora kia koe. Mangai Tauioko. Ae.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: Kei te whakamiharo te whatumanawa ki te Iwi Maori takitahi a katoa hoki mo te ahua o to ratou awhina i tenei Karanga—Victory Loan. Kua tae mai etahi reta maha ki ahau e whakatu ana i nga tikanga e taea ai e ratou te awhina tenei Karanga ki te Italia o ratou tinana me a ratou moni. Kei te mihi hoki ki nga Iwi katoa i inoi ki a hoatu a ratou moni kei te Tari Maori e tiaki ana, ki roto i te Roona—Victory Loan. Tena pea inaianei kua kite te Minita Maori i etahi reta naaku i huri ki aia, he inoi na nga Maori ki a wetekia mai a ratou moni i te Tari Maori ka kohi ai ki te Roona—Victory Loan. Kua in/it mai hoki te nuinga o nga hapu mo te maina koura o Hauraki. Ko Rotorua kei te whawhai ki a eke ta ratou awhina ki te £2,000 ara inaianei kei te £1,500. Ko enei ko nga kohi a nga iwi ara anga huihuinga nonohi, i runga i te kaha o to ratou pirangi ki te awhina. Whakamutunga me penei aku kupu; kaua e waiho te taimahatanga ki nga tangata e whawhai mai ra, a ki enei hoki e awhina atu nei i te kainga nei, engari kote katoa o nga moni e taea me kohi ki te Roona—Victory Loan— At a awe riro mai ai te wikitoria no te mea, i nga kore te wikitoria, kua kore he oranga, he maramatanga a Itnu kore hoki he moni.
Ratana, Haami Tokouru, Western Maori.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: E ta.hu whaea e puhi, tneto Papa mete Reweti, mete Whanau Pani, menga More-hit, tena koutou i te ahuatanga i to Tamaiti ia Tokouru to matou Tuakana i roto i te Ture Tangata, to latou Tumuaki iroto i te Ture Wairua, kua wehea nei i mua o te tirohanga kanohi. Kua pania nei talon e tenet kapua pouri taea te aha i tenei Tangata kaha ia aitua na ihowa i homai na ihowa i tango kia whakapaingia tana ingoa. Haere e taku Matua e Toko. Haere ki to taua papa ki te Mangai. Haere ki nga Nhaea, hat-re ki to teina kia Paraire. Haere Kinga Morehu e talari mai na i a hoe i te Whare Paremata 0 ihowa. Tirotiro kau ana ahau e taku Matua e Toko. Tu mokemoke ana matou o Teina i roto i te ana Raiona. Rapu ana nga whakaaro kowai hei whakakapi to tuuru. Haere e Toko. Haere.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: Haami Tokouru Ratana very well indeed.

speaker: The Hon Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: The boundary went from Maunga Tere to Maunga Atua.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: Haere e Koro, haere i runga ite ara Whanui, te kuarahi kua maro nei ite haeretanga o nga Tipuna, haere ki te nuitanga ote Iwi, haere e Koro ki te Ao Wairua.

speaker: Mr. RATANA
text: Enga Iwi. Enga Hapu •o Aotearoa, Te Waipounamu me Wharekauri. Tena koutou. Tena koutou. Te ahuatanga o nga Aitua maha i hinga nei ki runga i o .latott Marae. Otira kna tangihia, kua mihia ralou. Kua ea le wahanga ki a ratou. Tenei, ka huri ake ki nga matua me nga whanaunga o nga tamariki i hinga mai ra i roto i te mura o te ahi. Tena koutou i te ahuatanga o a koutou tamariki i hinga mai ra i te Pakanga. Tenei kei te mihi atu ki a Jtoutou ki te Taihauauru. Tena koutou, mo koutou i hapai i ahau hei to i tenei waka hei mahi noa hoki i nga mahi me nga tikanga i roto t te Ture Tangata. Tenei kei te mihi atu ki a koutou. Kia ora mai koutou.

speaker: Mr. OMANA
text: Tena koutou e taku Iwi Maori, o nga hau e wha o te Motu, i roto i nga manaaki tanga o te Matua, Tama, Wairua Tapu me nga Anahera Pono Mangai, Tautoko, ae. Mai i tera o taku korerotanga atu ki a koutou kei te tangi ki nga Aitua o enei ra. Tena koutou e te Whanau kua hoki mat i te marae o te pakanga, kei te niilii ki a koutou ki nga tamariki toa me o koutou koa pakeha.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: Whakamarama mo te penihana pouaru kore whai tamariki. Ko nga tau o te kaitono me rile ki te rima tehau nga tau; a e wha tekau nga tau o te kaitono i te wa i mate alu tana lane; a tekaii nga tau e noho ana raua i raro i te ture marena, a tekau ma rima tau mai o te ra marena, ki te ra o te tono mo te penihana. Ka haere tinana kotahi enei wahansa to kowha.

speaker: Mr. OMANA
text: nga iwi o te moiu, tena houtou. Tenet te laonga he Pire whahamaharatanga hi a taiau tamarihi hoia, me ta tatau tamaiti me Te Moana-Nui-a-Kiwa Ngarimu. Tena hoe Haami Ngarimu me to rangatira, me a tatau tamarihi Hoia—

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: E nga itvi o te motu, tena ano houtou i te ahuatanga i o tatou aitua. Tena houtou, tena houtou, tena houtou. E nga iwi o nga hau e wha, tenei ta tatou taonga, he tangi, he roimata mo a tatou tamarihi e tiraha mat ra i te marae o te riri— mo Ngarimu V.C. me ana hoa hua hinga nei hi te pahanga. E nga iwi o te Tai-Toherau hapaingia te tatou taonga—

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE (Member of the Executive Council representing the Native Race)
text: Haere e koro, whai nln i te nuitanga o te iwi whiti atu ki te wahangutanga o te tangata, haere ki te kaihanga.

text: Hoere e koro, u'hai alii i te niiitanga 0 te iwi, whiti alu ki te wahangutanga o te tangata, haere hi te kaihanga.

text: Ma nga niahi ka mohiotia te tangata, which means, "

text: Tena koutou e nga iwi e nga reo o te motu, i roto i nga manaakitanga a o /atan Ariki, Matua, Tama, Wairua Tapit me nga Anahera Pono, Mangai Tautoko ae. He mi hi atn ana ki nga aitiia maha o te motu. He nohoanga mtitunga tenet no te, ivhurc, ha niKtu ai tenei Paremata. I te wa c tu nei ko te Reipa te Kawanatanga, ka mii tona aroha me tona pai ki a talent hi te iwi Maori. Tena koutou. Tena kotttoit.

text: Ma nga him e whakaatu mai mehemea he pai he kino ranei, kei roto—

text: Building-timber includes totara, matai, rimu, and kauri.

text: E te Pika, tena hoe me to iwi Maori Una koe me kingi Koroki me Te Puea me nga iwi o Waikato-Maniapoto ntii tonu me o koutou marae. Tena Jtoutou katoa.

text: E te Pika, E aku iwi o Waikato tena koutou, Una hunt nit, Una koutou —

text: E nga iwi o te mottt, ki x koutoa e Waikato tena koutoa. Tenei kei tt tu fit i >i a at it taku reo mihi mo tenet fare IMO U Piri o Waikato.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: E te iwi o Waikato tena Routou, tena koutoa, tena koutoa—

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: JohnTekao, John Pere, Tiaki, Ko Te Hau, Matiaha, Ihaia, Waruwarutu, Topi, Ko Rirawa, Korehe, Ko te Poriohua, Wiremu, Ko Hape, Pukana Pukunui, Tuauau Manahe, Tuahuru, Te Hau, Ko te Uki, Ko te tohu tenei o Taiaroa, O Maopo, Paora Tau, Tainui, Koti, Karetai, Pohau, Wiremu Te Raki, Solomon Pohio, Te Whaikai Pokere, Rangiuhakana, Potiki, Tiari Weteri, Ko Tare te Haruru, Haereroa, Tiraki, Te Matahara.

text: Taiaroa and Solomon for Topi Kihau, son of Tuhawaiki Te Korako. Nga ingoa o te Kai-titiro—witnesses: N. A.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE (Member of the Executive Council representing the Native Kace)
text: Speaker, he kupu aroha enei na roto i te parekaivakawa ki to tatou rangaiira ki a Raniera.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE (Member of the Executive Council representing the Native Kace)
text: Ko te pohatu uhakamaharatanga ki a ia, ko te Mannga o Aorangi.

speaker: Mr. OMAN A
text: E te Pika, kei te mihi ahau ki a koe me nga honore mema o tenei IVhare, mo koutou i whakaae kia horero Maori ahau. Me penei aku horero, ma roto ia koe. E te Pika, e mihi ana ahau ki nga hau e wha o te motu, Tairawhiti, Taitokerau, Taihauauru, Waipounamu, whiti atu ki a koutou e noho mai na i runga o Wharekauri. Ki a koutou kua pa he aitua, kanui te aroha, kanui taku aroha ki te hoa wahine, me nga tamariki a Tama Matiu. Ko te mate tuarua tenei i roto i te waipuke o Wairarapa. Kei te tuku atu ahau i taku reo aroha ki tana whanau me tana tama, i na noa nei ka hoki mai i Hapani. Kaati i konei. Taku inoi, kia tau iho nga manaakitanga, a to tatou Ariki, Matua, Tama, Wairau Tapu me nga A nahera Pono, Mangai hei tautoko aianei ake ae.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: te Pika, hei te mihi ahau ki a koe me nga honore tnema o tenei Whare mo koutou i whakaae kia korero Maori ahau. Ma roto i a koe e te Pika, ka mihi ai ahau ki nga hait e wha o te motu nei; ki Te Waipounamu, Tairawhiti, Taitokerau me te Taihauauru, whiti atu ki a koutou e noho mai na i runga i Wharekauri. Kei te tautoko ahau i nga mihi a loku hoa mema, a te mema mo te Tairawhiti, ara mo nga aitua kua pa ki a tatou ki te iwi Maori. Ka nui te aroha ki a koutou o Nuhaka i te matenga o a koutou tamariki, a toe atu ki te weranga o nga tamariki pakeha i te hotera o Franz Joseph Glacier, a me te waipuke o Wairarapa. Kei te tino mihi atu ahau ki a koutou katoa e tu mokemoke ana i nga mate kua pa mai nei ki a tatou ki te iwi Maori. Kei te tuku atu ahau i taku reo aroha, ki nga whanau e rua te matenga o koutou matua rangatira i te waipuke o Wairarapa. Kaati e te iwi, tena koutou katoa.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: E nga iwi o nga hau e wha, tena koutou. Tena koutou i o tatou mate kua hinga ki runga i o tatou mate puta noa te motu. Tenei matou a koutou tatnariki kei te mihi atu ki a koutou mo koutou i whakaae kia hoki mai ano hex ringaringa hex waewae mo koutou ki roto i te Whare Paremata. Na reira, tena koutou.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: He toa taua mate taua, he toa piki pari mate pari, he toa piki rakau, he kai na te pakiaka. He toa ngaki kai, na te huhu tena.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE (Member of the Executive Council representing the Native Race)
text: Haere e koro, haere ki te kainga tuturu.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE (Member of the Executive Council representing the Native Race)
text: Na Ihoa i homai, na Ihoa i tango atu kia whakapaingia tona ingoa.

speaker: Mr. SULLIVAN (Bay of Plenty)
text: The four beneficiaries are Tamati Wharetakahia Hiki, Takatua Wharetakahia Hiki, Te Araiwini Wharetakahia Hiki, all of Ruatoki, and Paora Te Wiremu Waaka, of Waiohou.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE (Member of the Executive Council representing the Native Race)
text: Haere e koro, haere ki te kainga tuturu.

speaker: The Right Hon. Mr. FRASER (Prime Minister)
text: Ka whawhai tonu ake 1 ake 1 ake 1 '', meaning, “

speaker: The Hon. Mr. T1RIKATENE (Member of the Executive Council representing the Maori Race)
text: E okioki e Koro. Waiho ma o mahi whakamiharo hoe e hapai i roto o nga ra e haere tnai nei.

speaker: Mr. RATANA
text: E nga iwi e nga hapit lena koutou. Tuatahi e tnihi ana ahau ki te kai tuotini me te kai tautoko i nga take i puaki i te Kawana Tianara i te Whare. E hari ana hoki an i nga rongo whakawhiti tnai o to talou Kingi me te Kuini me to, raua Kotiro ki Niu Tireni. E lino kaha ana hoki toku tumanako me toku iwi Maori ki a talu te Kingi ki nga wahi tapu ara i whaii'hai ai nga Maori ki nga hoia a te Kuini. I whakaiaua ai nga he o aita whawhai ki nga Maori. Ka murua nga whenua o te Maori. Otira i tenei ra ka ara te Komihana ka ata whiriu'hiria enei take e tenei Kawanatanga Reipa ka kitea i riro he nga whenua o te Maori, no reira, kia ora.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: E men kino ki ie korero u'hanui, te kai korero ki tetahi kaupapa kahore e marama ana ki a ia.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE (Member of the Executive Council representing the Maori Race)
text: I would say, Haere e koro hi roto i te whenua whakaari, hono atu ki te >nii tanga o te iwi.

speaker: The DEPUTY S P E A K E R
text: E nga iwi o nga linn e who, tena koutou, i o tatou mate. Hacre e nga mate, haere. Tcnei niatou a kouiou tatnariki te mi hi atu ki o koutou, me te inoi mehemea he take a koutoii tukuna mai kia tnatou.

speaker: The DEPUTY S P E A K E R
text: tena koe! tena koe!

speaker: Mr. KEARINS (Waimarino)
text: Maniapoto, the Tuwharetoa, and the Ngati Maru.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE (Member of the Executive Council Representing the Maori Race)
text: namely, the Ngati Tama, the Ngati Mutunga, and the Ngati Maru and Te Atiawa.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: E nga iwi o te molu, Una koutou. Tena koutou i nga mate kua hinga nei ki runga i o . ifon marae. Ahakoa ko ahau anake ka korero atu ki a koutou ko ahau a Tirikatene, a Omana, a Ratana. No reira, tena ra koutou.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: He toa tana mate taua, he toa piki pari male pari, he toa piki rakau, he kai na te pakiaha. He toa ngaki kai, na te hnhu tena.

speaker: Mr. HOLYOAKE (Pahiatua)
text: Miia Pika, e hoa ma, kaore an e mohio ki te horero Maori.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: Matiu, nut atii te mokemoke kei runga i o hoa e noho ake nei i roto i tenei whareuwianga, ki nga pakeha me o hoa tuturii, a Tiaki Uinaiia, a Tapihana Paikea me ahau, ki a hoe kua ngaro atu i rolo i nga mahi nunui o te taha i tend whare me te Haahi Ratana. Ahakoa, kua takoto nga mihi i runga i a hoe i to tatou tnarae, me mihi ano ki a hoe, i roto i tenei u-hare i whakaingoatia e to kui, te pani, te whaea o to taua matua, a nana i whakapumau te ingoa, Te Ana Raiona. Koia e Matin, e te hoa, haere i rolo i tenei ra, whai atu i o tupuna, matua, me nga tamariki a Tumatauenga. Whai atu i a Paikea me to tuakana, Tokouru, whai atu i te Mangai, ki te kahiti ariki wairua, i tc torona o Ihoa. Kati nga mihi ki a koe. E Tiaki, e Tapihana, tena korua i te ahuatanga o Matiu kua ngaro atu i mua i a tatou i roto i tenei ra. E nga iwi o te main, tena koutou i tenei ailua nui kua pa ki te motn. E nga iwi o Te Taihauauru, tena koutou i te itgaronga o Matiu Ratana i nga tikanga o te Whare Paremata. Kua nolw pani koutou, koia te mihi atu ki a koiiloit. Kia u, kia manawanui. E te whanan, e. Iriaka me ena o a tatou tamariki, kia u, kia tiaho ano te maramatanga ki runga ki a koutou. E le morehu nui tonu, e te Haahi, kia «, kia pono i mua i o tatou ariki me te whakamoemiti ki te Mangai. Kati nga mihi i konei. Ka hurt ki te reo pakeha.

speaker: Mr. OMANA
text: E nga hau e wha o te Motit, tena koutou. Tena koutou i roto i nga manaakitanga a to tatau Ariki. Tena koutou i te ahuatanga o nga aitua e hinga nial na e hinga atu nei. Heoi te korero, haere ki U iwi, haere ki te kainga. I tenei ra kei te tangi tatau ki a Matiu Ratana. No reira, Matiu, haere. Kanui te pouri, kanui te aroha. Kua noho mokemoke ahau to hoa i roto i te Whare. Haere e hoa! Kci te tangi nga tiiema katoa ki a koe. Kua pani te Hahi Rataiia. E to hoa haere! Tenei ano te tangi atit ki te whanau e noho mai na i te pa o Ratana. Iriaka kia main. E piri ki te Matua i te Rangi, hei hoa mohou me nga tamariki, Matiu haere ra. Ma te wa e whakatittaki ano.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE
text: Ko nga putiputi whero o te rata kua maroke, ko te tinana rakau, kua hinga kt runga i te moenga kawakawa o Hinc-nuite-po. Hacre c koro.

speaker: Mrs. RATANA
text: E te mauri o te motu, kingi Koroki, te ihi, te mana, term koe, tena koe, tena koe, me to whaea me Te Puea, tena korua—o tipuna, korua, kuia, maatua, whaea. Tena koutou katoa. E te iwi morehu mai i te rercnga wairua, Maunganui, Tamaki, Mokau, Mangatoatoa, Parininihi, Waitotara, Tawhitikuri, Miria te Kakara, Whitireia, Whanganui-a-Tara, whiti ki te Waipounamu me Wharekauri, tena koutou, tcna koutou, tena koutou.

speaker: Mrs. RATANA
text: To the remnant peoples from Cape Reinga, Maunganui, Tamaki, Mokau, Mangatoatoa, Parininihi, Waitotara, Tawhitikuri, Miria te Kakara, Whitireia, Whanganui-a-Tara thence to the Waipounamu, Wharekauri, greetings.

speaker: Mr. OMANA
text: E nga hau e wha o te motu: Tai-Tokerau, Tai-hauauru, Waipounamu, me te Tai-Rawhiti, Tena koutou katoa. I te wa i ivhai korero ai ahau ki a koutou i tera Paremata tae mai ki tenei wa, ka nui o koutou kua pa he aitua, no reira, ka tuku atu ahau i taku aroha. Tena koe e Apirana, ka nui te aroha he rongo kei te mauiui koe. Ka inoi tonu ahau kia piki te ora ki to tinana, kia tu ai koe ki waenganui o nga iwi o te motu ka tae ki to marae i Waiomatatini, i nga ra o Hepetema. Kia tae mai ano koe ki roto o te Whare Paremata, he mema no te Whare Ariki. Ka nui taku whakamihi ki te komiti o Mangatu, ki te tiamana, Kani Te Ua, me te hekeretari, Eddie Hooper, ka nui te pai o ta koutou mahi. Ka rua tati te wehcnga 0 Mangatu ki waho o te trust ka whakakaporeihanatia me tona komiti whakahaere. 1 taua wa e tata ana ki te £130,000 te mokete i te korero a te hekeretari, i tenei wa e ki ana a ia kua rite taua mokete. I roto i tenei taima poto, he mea whakamiharo tenei. Enei whenua mai rano kaore e heke iho ana te mokete i te £100,000. I te wa i timata tenei komiti £130,000 te mokete.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA (Northern Maori District)
text: Ruapotaka, in the Tamaki area; Onehunga.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA
text: E nga hau e wha, tena koutou. I o tatou aitua kua hinga nei ki runga i o tat on tint marae. Tena koutou i te aitua 0 Apirana Ngata kua hinga nei i tenei ra.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. HOLYOAKE
text: Au mea kaore mohio ki te korero Maori.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. TIRIKATENE (Southern Maori District)
text: Na te mamae i huaina ake at i te reo o tatou tupuna kua riro i te ringa kaha o aitua, kua haruru ki te whenua te totaranui o te waonui a Tane. Haruru ana tona hinganga ano he whatitiri e paoho ana ki nga topito o te motu. Aku mihi taurangi ki to tatou hoa, kua pikituria atu nei e ia te pae maunga, te tihi o Hikurangi. Kua hcke atu ia ki Paerau ki te reinga, te ao o te wahangutanga e pukci mai ra nga koiwi o nga tupuna o nga matua. Kia huri ake au ki nga awa wairere e tere nei: a Waiapu, a Waikato, a Whanganui, a W aimakariri. Huiatu ki nga kopua moana: a Rotorua, a Rotoiti, a Taupo, a Wanaka. He kahui tokomaha, he wai i pupu mai i nga matapuna o Papatuanuku, e tere atu ra ki te waha o te Parata, ano he waikamo, he roimata c ripo kau ana i te piko awa, e tangi ana i te kawenga o te mamae te aroha. Tenei tatou nga mema Maori o te Whare Paremata e tuohu nei. He kawenga na te aroha ki a Ta Apirana Ngata, e haehae nei i o tatou tinana ki to tatou matua. Ko tatou nei ana tamariki, nga mea tane, me nga mea wahine Haere e te hikongauira, haere atu me to whanau e pukai mai ra i te marae o Tumatauenga. Haere atu koutou. Hoe atu i runga i nga waka wairua; whakawhiti i te moanapuhoru ki te huinga o te kahurangi, kaore he hokinga mai. Nga mihi taurangi kia koe e Ngata mo au tino hanga pai ki to iwi Maori. Tenei o hanga hei rahui mai ma o iwi maha; nga moteatea a nga tupuna, nga waiata, nga rarangi whakapapa, nga patere, me nga mahi whakairo. Nau i whakaora nga whare wananga, nga whare karakia hei whakamaharatanga mo nga wa kei te takahuri mai. E tautoko ana ahau i nga mihi ki a koe e Ta Apirana Ngata, te uri o nga tangata. Haere te whetumataiata, haere atu i te marae wharanui o Porourangi ki te tihi o to maunga o Hikurangi. Te ao katoa kei te tangi kia koe te Emepaea, nga moutere o te kotahitanga o te ao kei te tangi kia koe. Haere koe te pouraiti o te pakeha me nga iwi Maori. E kore koe e warewaretia i nga ra kei te haere mai i muri nei. Ahakoa ngaro noa koe ko au mahi tu tonu i roto i tenei Whare Paremata. Oti pu i a koe nga ture whaitikanga, kaore he mea i kore te oti. O nga mea i oti, ko te ipuakura e kore e piri kia koe. Haere atu te tama kotahi, te nui o tenei motu, te tangata i herea ki te kupu o te Maoritanga. Ma te ao koe e tangi i muri nei. Ki to whanau pani, me te iwi i uhia ki te kapua pouri, tangohia toku aroha hei mutunga ake mo taku tangi.

speaker: Mr. PAIKEA (Northern Maori District)
text: E kara, e Api, haere ki te iwi, haere ki te whanau a Tumatauenga. Haere ki o matua tupuna. Haere ki te kainga tuturu mo taua mo te tangata. Ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa, ko Apirana Ngata te tangata. Kua riro to tinana ko te wairua me o mahi kei waenganui i a matou. Haere e koro, haere.

speaker: The Hon. Mr. MARUMARU

Aue! te pouri, te tangi e! Kua hoki a ia ki Tawhitinui, ki Tcnvhitipamamao, ki te Honoiwairua. Kua manu a ia i runga i te waka o tenei tanqata kaha o Aitua. Haere, haere, haere!

speaker: Mr WETERE
text: Kua ora, kua oho te wairua ote Maori; no te Rangatahi hoki i penei ai; i pakari ai nga whakaaro hou, i hoki ano ai nga whakaaro ki nga tikanga o nga matua tapuna; i whei inu ai, i pirangi ai kite kaupapa nei, kia tu taua ki runga i o taua waewae a kia riro hoki o taua nei whakaaro ma taua ano e whakatere, kia mahara ai taua kite puriti i to taua mana, wehi, me to taua ihi. I muri iho i ten a, tukua nga ua kia maringi ki runga i nga puke a kia rere atu hoki enei wai ora ki runga i nga taone, kia puawai ai te noho a nga tini whanaunga kei rcira e noho ana. No reira, kia mahara, me tino whaka rongo mai koutou ki tenei whaka—ara tanga hou, na te mea, a nga ra tata nei ka whiti enei whakaaro hei Ra; Ra tino kaha te whiti; whaka uira—uira pai.

E nga iwi ote motu, tena koutou mo te awhinatanga mai i te roopu reipa kua tu nei hei kawanatanga. No reira i tenei wa kei te titiro atu matou kia koutou mo nga mauiui o te motu. Tena koutou katoa.

speaker: Mr COUCH (Wairarapa)
text: Taku, Rangatira Ropata Muldoon, te pirimia o niu tireni, tena koe, e hika io tatou whanau Maori kato. E tu atu nei, na, no, reira, kia mau, kia kaha, na kua pupuritia kito mahi o nga iwi o Aotearoa, ai no reira e hika ma, tena ra koe e hoa.

speaker: Mr COUCH (Wairarapa)
text: Tena Koe E Takana MacIntyre, e Minita koe, o nga iwi mahi Maori katoa, na reira e hika, kia mau matauranga, ki o tatou Maori katoa, o engahau e wha o niu tireni. Na reira, kua mohio ana koe, mote mea Maoritanga o tatau tipuna Maori ote motu na no reira tena koe, tena koe kito, Maori katoa.

text: Tena ra, e Whetu, Matiu, Koro, Brownie, me a Rex tena koutou katoa. Kanui, te hari, te koa o taku, ngakau moku, ka kitea ia koutou I tenei wa, no reira kia ora koutou, katoa.

speaker: Mr COUCH (Wairarapa)
text: Tihei mauri ora, taku iwi, ote, turangawaewae tenei ote Wairarapa, tena koutou, tena koutou, tena koutou katoa. Na he Rangatira o tenei waahi, kia mau ki to Maoritanga na kua tata nei kia koutou kite iwi kia—kotahi tatou katoa.

speaker: Mr COUCH (Wairarapa)
text: Taku roopu rangatahi, raua ko nga iwi kaumatua katoa. Kia mau, kia koutou kite whaia ote matauranga ote pakeha na no reira, hei ara mo to tinana na kua pupuritia kito tatou Maori tanga o enga tupuna Maori katoa, no reira kia mau, kia kaha, na kia ora hui hui mai tatou katoa.

speaker: Mr COUCH (Wairarapa)
text: Kia koutou me whakarongo o taku reo. Kia tonui te turu o nga minita pakeha katoa kite whare waananga nei. Na ka. Ti-tiro atu ote tangata—o Sir James Carroll I whakamamahi ite reo ote Maori opere. Na kua ahau he tangata minita o nga mea ote Maori he turu nei. Taku aroha ki tenei haere mai io te ra, kua homai, to mea pai ra.

speaker: Mr WETERE (Western Maori)
text: Te mea tuatahi ki te honore mema o Wairarapa, tena koe i roto i te ahuatanga i o tatou matua tupuna. Nau mai, haere mai i roto i tenei whare ataahua otira te kainga i waihoatia ai e ratou ma. No reira, nau mai, haere mai, haere mai. Kua mihia koe i o tatou mate a ta turi kara, taku matua a te hurinui, etehi o ratou ma kua huri ano ki tua o te arai. text: Ki nga tupuna ratou kua huaina te tikiti o Waitangi, e mihia, e karangatia, e tangihia, kei a ratou te rangatikatanga o tenei kaupapa. Ki a matou nga whakatupuranga nga huahua o tenei o ratou maui rangatira e tu ake au ki te hihi ki to tatou iwi rangatira o Te Atiawa kei a koutou e noho atu kei raro te marumaru o to haunga teitei, te maunga Taranaki, te taunga hoatu koutou ki te kawanatanga kei nga iwi katoa o Aotearoa tena koutou tena koutou, tena koutou katoa Ma te atua kei runga rawa e hanaki, e kakahuangia te kaupapa nei.

speaker: Rt. Hon. D. MacINTYRE (Deputy Prime Minister)
text: No reira ko te mca tuatahi me wehi ki te Atua, a, me whaka-honore to tatou Ariki e noho mai ra i runga ano i te Torona tapu o tana papa me ona tupuna tae noa ki tona Hoa raneatira me a raua tamariki mokopuna ano hoki tae noa ki te whare Ariki katoa. E nga hau e wha o te motu e tau nei ki roto ki tenei whare whakaharahara, tena koutou, tena koutou, tena koutou. E tautoko ana i nga mihi kua mihia atu nei i nga kai korero, nga kai hautu i mua i ahau ki to tatou aitua ki ta Horioka. No reira e te matua o te motu, haere ki o tatou matua, haere ki o tatou tupuna, haere ki te kainga i hangatia ai to tatou Kaihanga mo koutou mo te hunga kua huri atu ki tua o te arai. Ahokoa kua hinga koe me ki ko nga taonga, ko nga kaupapa i hanga i e koe hei tauira mau mo to whanau tae noa ki te motu i tenei ra. Ahakoa i kimihai i tenei me te korero mou me te mohio ano e tangi ana te motu mai te Rerengawairua, a, whiti atu ki te Waipounamu ki te Wha re kauri ano hoki ki a koe me ngo taonga i korerohia nei e ahau ki a koe. No reira e te Papa, haere, haere ki te kainga, haere ki o tatou Matua whai muri atu o matua kua tae atu ki te kainga i korerohia nei ahau kua tae atu nei ki te kainga. No reira haere, haere, haere.

speaker: Rt. Hon. D. MacINTYRE (Deputy Prime Minister)
text: E pa to hau e wini raro e homai aroha ra Kia tangi atu au i konei He aroha ki te iwi ka momotu ki tawhiti ki paerau Ko wai e kite atu kei whea aku hoa i mua raa i te tonuitanga ka haere mai tenei ka tauwehe ka rauna iti au i. No reira tena koutou, tena koutou, tena huihui katoa tatou.

Ko taua rangatiratanga, ko nga taonga tukuiho a te Iwi Maori; a, kia maharatia ano hoki te ahua nei, ko te whenua te turangawaewae o te Iwi Maori. No reira me kaha te pupuri i te whenua me te aru tikanga e pumau ai te noho, a, e puta ai he hua ki te Iwi, A e tika ana, me hanga he ahuatanga hei awhina i te Iwi ki te whakamana i enei kaupapa.

speaker: Hon. K T. WETERE (Minister of Maori Affairs)
text: I rongo atu au i nga korero o te honore mema o Tauranga. Anei ke te korero i korerohia ai e tona tupuna; " He aha ra te mea nui? He tangata! he tangata! he tangata! Tera ke te korero mau, i te mea kei te mohio tonu tatou, mai rano i te whanau mai tanga o te tangata tuatahi tae noa mai ki te rangi nei e mohiotia nei e tatou tona waka, tona hapu, tona iwi ahu atu i tenei rangi. Tera ke te korero. E te Iri nei te ingoa o te wahine nei e mohiotia nei koe koia hoki tenei o tera o to whanaunga i toku nei whakaaro he aha ai i kore mohio ai nau hoki te wahine nei. Koia nei ra te korero. Kei te mohio tonu koe i ahu mai tenei kaupapa mai rano i o matua i korerohia ai i runga i o tatou marae—koia ra te korero. Otira me titiro ano tatou i roto i te wahanga tuawaru o nga kaupapa e korero ana te tari o te ture e hanga nei te ture i tenei ra rua ratou hei tiaki hei turaki ranei kia whaka tae ai e ratou e mohio tia ai ratou he tangata. Tera ke te korero i roto ite wharangi tuawaru roto i te pepa i korero nei i te Ture o te Tari. Nau ke nga korero, rua te Whare Paremata hei turaki ranei hei whakatau ranei, anei ke nga korero e korerohia nei e tatou i tenei ra. No reira mau ra e whakaaro atu i tera, me te mohio ano, he aha ai te take e korero ai koutou i te wa e kawauatanga e koutou i whakataungia ai i tenei Pire i Hanuere i te tau kotahi mano iwa rau waru tekau ma wha. Tera ke te wa i haria mai te tohoa i tenei Pire i roto i tenei whare kia kokiringia ai i tera wa. He aha te take i haere mai i tenei rangi, ara i tenei tau hei korero atu te take nei. Me te mohio ano e he ana hoki nga Roia hei mahi i tenei take me te mohio ano e tatou anei te kaupapa, ma ratou hei whiriwhiri i tenei take e tatou i tenei rangi. No reira e taku rangatira me ata titiro i runga i nga kaupapa i korerohia ai e o matua tupuna. Mohio tonu nga rarangi i korerohia e ratou. No reira e te Heamana tena koutou, otira tena ano tatou katoa.

speaker: Mr TERRIS
text: He aha te mea nui niaku e ki? He tangata, he tangata, he tangata.

speaker: Hon. K. T. WETERE (Minister of Maori Affairs)
text: No reira e te heamana kei te mihi atu ki te honore mema e tautoko ana i te kaupapa kua whakatakotoria i mua i te aroaro o te whare i tenei po. A, ki au nei e tautoko ano korero he mea whakahirahira me te mohio ano i korerohia ai i o tatau matua i o tatou tupuna, e korerohia nei koe ko ta Apirana pera i korerohia ai i roto i tenei whare. A, i tenei ra kei te mihi atu ki a koe ara me te komiti whai whakaaro atu i te kaupapa kia uru ai penei i roto i nga kaupapa o te whare nei. No reira kei te mihi tonu ake.

speaker: Dr GREGORY (Northern Maori)
text: E tu kau ake nei ki te tautoko nga korero o nga mema e tu mua i e hau, ko nga whakaaro o te Minita Maori, o tene, kaupapa ki te whakatikatika tenei take o pai ano. No reira e te nemara tena ra pae.

speaker: Mr PETERS
text: Koe koe hoki kei te korero koe i te reo Maori?

speaker: PAUL EAST (Rotorua)
text: E te kai hautu tena koe otira whare katoa i tenei.

speaker: Dr GREGORY (Northern Maori)
text: E te kaihau o tenei runanga me nga mema o to whare, tena koutou katoa.

speaker: TREVOR MALLARD (Hamilton West)
text: Tena koe, Mr Speaker, tena koutou, tena koutou, tena koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon. K. T. WETERE (Minister of Maori Affairs)
text: Te Hemana, kokoe te Rangatira o tenei whare. Tenei rate mihi atu ki a koe, oti ra kite whare e whakaaro nei ite kaupapa. Me ki ko te kau ma tahi peate tau i whakaarohia ai i tenei whare itenei kaupapa. Itera wa ko te mema o waitotara te kaihautu o tenei kaupapa. I teneira ko hoki maike taku tuahine mana i kokiri ai i roto i te whare nei hei whakaarohia ai e tatou i te kaupapa e mahiotia tenei o tatou. Tuatahikei te mihiatu ki a ia a me tatou katoa e whakaaro mei i te kaupapa e pehi nei ki runga i a tatou. Otira ite marama o Mei i tenei tau itu ai te hui o nga Wahine Maori toko ite Ora ki roto o Heretaunga. I reira itantokongia ai te kaupapa i roto i tenei pire. I tuhingia ai e au kia rateu, pehea oratou whakero kite kaupapa nei, me te te mohio anoka nui tatou te iwi Maori kua tai ki roto ki tenei kaupapa. Kotaku i mea atukia ratou, he taonga a o tatou matua me whakaaro atu ai e ratou. Maku e ki atu kei te mohio tonu tatou i nga taonga a o tatau matua mo tenei, e penei anate korero. He aha rate meanui makura e ki atu–he tangata, he tangata, he tangata. Ko wai o tatau hei whaka he itera taonga i korerohia e ratau maira ano i te wa a tai ano ki te rangi rei. I runga ano i tenei rerenga korero ara i waihotia e ratou kei whea he korero maku kite whaka turikina itera whakaaro e hangatia e ratou. Teneite whakaaroo to koutou mokai, “ me tu ki runga ki nga kaupapa i waihotia e ratou kite tantoko ai i tenei pire mai tona timatanga, a tae anoki tona mutunga. Noreira kei aku rangatira, tenei rate mihi atuki a tatou katoa e hui nei i teni po me te mohio anote nuinga o to motu e whakaea ana kia penei tatou. Noreira tena koutou, tena koutou, tena anotatou katoa.

text: E te tumuaki tena koe. Te Whare Paremata e tunei nga mema o te motu, tena koutou katoa. Ka nui te koa kua puta mai tenei pire kimua ite aroaro o te whare parenata. He karanga tenei no te iwi kia ea ai nga wawata a o ratou matua tipuna. A katika hoki mate kawanatanga e whakaae kia tu penei te runanga o Ngati Porou. Mote iwi o Ngati Porou.

speaker: Hon. K. T. WETERE
text: E te rangatira, tena koe. Nau i te taonga i hangi i roto i tenei kaupapa i mohio i tenei i a tatou, mairanei i o tatou matua i otatou tupuna i te ranginei i Whakatuhera ngia aii otatou ariki—te Whare Paremata. A tai atuki otatou matua a Ta Taare Peneti, a me Ralph Makere Love ano, a tai noa mai ki Ngati Kahungunu ratou i Whaka tau ki roto ki a ratou a motatou mote iwi i tenei ra. No reire tenei te mihiki a koutou, a-tena koutou, tena koutou.

text: Taranaki Maunga, Taranaki tangata, mai Parininihi ki Waitotara, otira tatou katoa i roto i tenei whare, tenei koutou, tenei koutou, tenei koutou.

speaker: Dr GREGORY (Northern Maori)
text: Ki te Maunga Taranaki, Te Maunga te rangatira te Maunga tuturu e tu Maira tene hae tena koe tena koe.

speaker: Hon. RUSSELL MARSHALL (Minister of Education)
text: Te maunga Taranaki, tena koe, enga iwi o Taranaki, tena koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon. K. T. WETERE (Minister of Maori Affairs)
text: E te rangatira, te tumuaki o te whare, tena koe. Enga mema o te Whare Paremata, tena koutou, tena koutou, tena koutou. Etino koa anate ngakau, e rau rangatira ma, i tenei wa, kei ahau te turanga hei tuku atu tenei Pire I mua I tearoaro o tenei whare. Kia ahau nei kua tutuki nga wawata otatou matua, kua weheatu kite po. Kia koutou e koro ma, e kui ma, moe mai ra i roto i enei wavata. No reira e te rangatira, ko te kaupapa o tenei Pire, hei whakamana i te reo Maori ki roto i te ture.

speaker: Hon. K. T. WETERE
text: Kinga whakaaro o te iwi Maori, me te Kawanatanga nei, te whakakaupapatia maite reo I roto I te Tiriti o Waitangi, ahakoa he taonga tuku iho mai I nga tupuna. Kaati, e hiahia anamatou o te Kawanatanga kia whakapumautia te reo I runga ano I ta matou kaupapa pooti. Na reira ko tenei Pire te whakatinana o era korero. E torunga tikanga kei roto I tenei Pire. Tuatahi–e whakapuaki I te reo Maori hei reo tuturu mo Niu Tireni. Tuarua—he whakamana I te korero Maori I roto Inga whakahaere o te ture. Tuatoru—he whakatu I te Komihana mote reo Maori. He marama tonu te take e whakamanatia nei te reo. He tika kia whai mana te reo Maori I roto Inga whakahaere. Engari, e whaiti anate mana kite kaikorero anake kaore e ahei ki te whakahau me whakautu mai tetahiatu I roto I te reo Maori. Ko tenei kaupapa kua whai mana ke I roto Inga whakahaere o te Whare Paremata. Kaore hoki he whakararuraru ate Pire Inga mahi a te tetahi Minita, tari, tangata, ropu ranei mo nga mahi e pa anaki te reo Maori. Kaore te Pire nei I kati I te whakawhanui atu ranei I te mana o te korero Maori I tua atu I nga whakatakotoranga kei roto nei. Hei whakapumau Inga kaupapa o tenei Pire, e tika aname whakatu he Komihanamo te reo Maori. Mana e whakatakoto nga huarahi kia pakari ai te noho hei reo korerorero. Ko to Komihana neihei kaitiakimo to reo. Kotana mahi hei whakau nga take a te iwi, a te Kawanatanga, a, he tuku ripoata kite Paremata ia tau. E tokorima nga tangata mo tenie Komihana e tika aname matau aiki te reo me nga take hokie tau mai ke tearoaro o tenei Komihana a ma ratou e raihana nga tangata kua matau ki tenei reo. Ete wa e tika anae te Hemana, katuku ana tenei Pire I mua i te aroha o te komiti o nga whakahaere o nga mema Maori I roto i tenei whare.

speaker: Rt. Hon. K. T. WETERE
text: Nga reo, nga mana, nga waka, nga pu korero. Onga pau e whau rau rangatira ma. Tena koutou, tena koutou, tena koutou katoa.

No reira kei te mihiki a ia me ona tuakana, mo tenei whakaaro honore me te mohio ano i te wa i a ratou hei Kawanatanga i roto i te whare nei. Kore rawa ratou i te tungia te kaupapa Maori mohio i teneiotatou reo. I teneira ko kite aie ia i nga taonga o taua matua, o tatou tupuna, tenei te mihi ki a ia. Mehemea kaora e mohio i a ia, i nga hi, i nga mana, i nga taonga, o koro ma, o kui ma, tenei rate wa mana hei titiro atu i nga kaupapa e korero nei i a tatou i tenei ra. speaker: Hon. K. T. WETERE (Minister of Maori Affairs)
text: Kaore, engari kua whakamaoritia keetahi o nga pire. He uaua te whakamaoria nga pepa katoa e pa ana kite ture, engaritera pea e pai ake aname whakamaori tuatahi nga pepa e paatu ana kite iwi whanui.

speaker: Hon. JONATHAN HUNT (Minister of Broadcasting)
text: No reira, ka huri au kite reo onga o karanga maha hei whakamarama ki a ratou. No reira, enga karanga maha o runga o nga maraae maha puta noa o te motu. Tena ra koutou. Tena rakoutou e whakarongo mai na ki tenei to koutou mokai e korero anae pa ana ki tenei take. He take nunui mo tatou te iwi Maori. Ko te hiahia o te kawanatanga, o te kawanatanga raepa, hei whakahoki nga whenua nate kawanatanga i muru atu i nga ra o mua. No reira, tena rakoutou arame otatou tini aitua e hingamai ana, e hingaatu ana.

speaker: Hon. PETER TAPSELL (Minister of Internal Affairs)
text: Te tangata i whanau ite wahine he toru toru ona ra. Ano he puawaiia e puta mai anae kotia iho ana.

speaker: Hon. PETER TAPSELL (Minister of Internal Affairs)
text: E hoa ahakoa kahore roa tou nohoanga i waenganui i a matou engari koa tae mai ki te wa o tou tutakitanga kia ratou ou matua outipuna noriera haere kirunga i nga kupu korero o nga rangatira haere ki runga i nga roimata o nga wahine haere whai atu i a ratou kua haere ki tua o tearai haere haere haere.

speaker: Hon. ANN HERCUS (Minister of Social Welfare)
text: Te Rohe Potae O Rereahu Maniapoto Inc.

speaker: Hon. RUSSELL MARSHALL (Minister of Education)
text: In Hamilton they are Whitiora, Tauranga South, Mt Maunganui Primary, Apanui, Whakatane Kawerau Central, Whakarewarewa, Rotorua, Rotorua Primary, Hilltop, Taupo, and Matarawa, Tokoroa.

speaker: Dr GREGORY (Northern Maori)
text: E te whare tena ra koe. Kua tae mai te wa kite pa ananga korero o tenei kaupapa rangatira Te Pire Mo Te Reo Maori ki runga te tepu o tenei whare. E torunga mahi a tenei Pire. Ko te mea Tuatahi, he whakapuaki i roto i te reo Maori heireo tuturu mo Niu Tireni. Ko te mea Tuarua, kia whaiwahanga te korero i roto i te reo Maori i nga whakahaere o te ture. Kote mea Tuatoru, he whakatuturu he whakamotuhake i nga mahi me nga mana o te Komihana o Te Reo Maori.

speaker: Hon. K. T. WETERE (Minister of Maori Affairs)
text: He mihi tuatahi ki te Hemana, nana i kokiritia ai tenei Pire, i roto i te Komiti a, tae noa atu ki te Whare i tenei ra. Noreira e taku Rangatira tena koe. I whaka hau nei i nga taonga a otatou matua me o tatou tupuna, me te mohio anora kaore ratau e mohio ana, ara i tena taha o te Whare, ki te Ihi, te Mana, te Tapu i tenei o tatou, e Kokiri nei tatou i tenei ra. Noreira, tena koe, tena tatou katoa.

speaker: Mr DEPUTY SPEAKER
text: No reira, ki aku nei karanga maha o runga i o koutou marae i o koutou kainga. Tena koutou. Kanui te koa te hau o te ngakau nate mea kua tae mai kite wa. Kakite ai tatou te puawaitanga o nga whakaaroo nga wawata o nga moemoenga o nga moatua o nga tipuna i te wa oratou. No reira, tena ra koutou, aramea o tatou tini aitua e hingamai ana, e ningatua ana. Tena koutou, tena koutou, tena ana tatou.

speaker: Mr McKINNON
text: The Maori Language Commission is referred to as Te Komihana Mo Te Reo Maori.

speaker: KATHERINE O’REGAN (Waipa)
text: Ngauri o nga hapu o Ngati Porou, mai Potikirua ki Te Toka a Taiau”

speaker: Winston Peters
text: Does the Maori Reserved Land Act deny Maori landowners access to the economic benefits they could otherwise obtain from their land? Hon. K. T. WETERE: I toku nei whakaaro, ae. Koinei au i whakatungia he komiti, hei titiro i nga ahuatanga i pana ki tenei ture. Koia ra te he i te haere mai o tena prie i roto i te whare nei.

speaker: Hon. WINSTON PETERS
text: Tena koe, Koro, te Minita Maori i nga ra kua pahure. In addition to passing on my greetings, felicitations, and commiserations to the member I want to say that I am considering the future of Te Tira Ahu Iwi, and a decision will be announced very soon. K. T. Wetere: Te mea, ko te whakautu ki te patai kaore e rereke nga whakaaro i korerohia ai e te mema i te wa o te poti.

speaker: Hon. K. T. WETERE
text: Tuatahi kei te Minita, kei te mihi atu ki te Minita Kaiawhina i nomai ano i te Pire ki a au i te rangi nei, hei titiro i mua i te timatanga i roto i te Whare, i tenei wa. No reira, tenei ra te mihi atu ki a koe me nga mihi ki o tatau mate, ki te iwi nui tonu, puta noa te motu. No reira tena koe.

speaker: Mr SPEAKER-ELECT
text: Mr Prime Minister, Ministers, and fellow members of Parliament, I know that members will forgive me if I speak first, and briefly, in Maori. No reira, e te tuakana e Koro, korua ko Whetu---ka huri nga whakaaro ki te tau 1981, takuna tae mai nei ki konei, na korua i awhi mai, i tautoko mai, i manaaki mai, tenei to korua taina. No reira, tena korua, tena korua, tena korua. Tena ra koe e te tuakana, ara, me te moko puna o te motu*** e noho mai ra i runga i te ahurewa tapu o ona matua, ona tipuna. E nga karanga maha i waenga nui i a koutou, e Tau, koutou ko te tu mai i te wa tuatahi ki tenei Whare---ko tenei te mihi, te aroha rawa atu. Mauria mai, a, kawea mai nga mate kei runga i a koutou. Mauria mai te aroha me te mana i waihotia e ratau. No reira tena koutou, tena nga mata waka, koutou e whakarongo mai na i o koutou kainga, i o koutou marae---ko tenei te mihi te aroha rawa i runga i te ahuatanga, ki o tatau tini mate. Ko nga mate o ia whanau, o ia hapu, o ia iwi me ki---haere koutou, haere koutou, haere koutou. No reira kaua e riri mai---e mutu ake nga korero i konei, tena koutou, tena koutou, tena ano tatau.

speaker: The New Scientist went on to state
text: Nō reira, ko Aoraki te maunga, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Arahura te awa, ko Poutini te taniwha, ko Tuhuru te tangata, ko Poutini Kai Tahu te hapu, ko Kai Tahu te iwi. He Maori ahau.

speaker: The gospel is taken from a verse from Paul to the Corinthians
text: ``Anō te āhua reka o te noho tahitanga o ngā tēina me ngā tuākana i runga ano i te whakaaro kotahi.

speaker: Hon. Mrs T W M TIRIKATENE-SULLIVAN
text: Ko te tuatahi, tēnei au tētahi o ngā mōkai o te iwi i roto i tēnei ana raiona e mihi atu ki Te ātairangikaahu - Te Ariki nui rāua ko Whatumoana me ā rāua tamariki, ā rāua mokopuna hoki, ā, ki te Kāhui Ariki me te Poari o Tainui - ki a koe te heamana e noho atu nei, ā, ki Te Kotahi rāua ko Reiha me ā kōrua whānau. Tēnei au te mihi atu ki a koutou, ā, ki a koutou Tainui whānui hoki.

speaker: TAU HENARE
text: E te kaikōrero, e te kaikōrero kaha rawa ki a koe i tēnei rā. He honore au kei te tū kei te korero i mua i a koutou. Tēnei te hōnore kei a koe e Te Ata-IRangi-Kaahu me tana hoa tāne a Whatumoana me tā rāua whānau, Te Kāhui Ariki. Kei a koutou ngā morehu o ngā aituā, kei a koutou Tainui, tēnā koutou katoa i haere mai nei i tēnei rā ki te tautoko i tēnei kaupapa. Kei te tū au ki te tautoko i tēnei kaupapa, nō reira, mihi atu au ki a koutou, ā, mihi atu au ki a koutou ngā morehu. Kei a koe e te Minita, ā, kaua e pāpōuri ki ahau nā te mea kāore au i te tū i tō kōrero, nō reira kei a koe, tenei te mihi me te tautoko ki a koe.

speaker: Hon. WINSTON PETERS
text: E ngā mātua, e ngā karanga maha me ngā hoa, tena koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon. K T WETERE
text: Nō reira, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tena koutou katoa.

speaker: Mr SPEAKER
text: Anei te pātai, e whakaae ana tātau katoa ki te mōtini? Ki a rātau e whakaae ana, me ki ``Ae''.

speaker: Mr SPEAKER
text: Bill read a third time. Mr SPEAKER: Nō reira, tēnā koe, tēnā rā koutou, ka pai te hokinga atu ki te kāinga.

speaker: JIM GERARD
text: I am directed to present a report. I move, That the report of the Standing Orders Committee on the review of the Standing Orders do lie upon the table. Motion agreed to. TE RUNANGA O NGAI TAHU BILL Report of Maori Affairs Committee Hon. K T WETERE (Chairman of the Maori Affairs Committee): E te Reo Mangai o te Whare. Anei te pūrongo a te Komiti Motuhake Mo Nga Take Māori mo te Pire o Te Rūnanga o Ngāi Tahu. Ko taku motini kia takoto ai te purongo i runga i te tēpu. I am directed to present a report. I move, That the report of the Maori Affairs Committee on the Te Runanga o Ngai Tahu Bill do lie upon the table. The committee has carefully considered the Bill, and finds that the allegations in the preamble have been proved to its satisfaction. It recommends that the Bill be allowed to proceed with the amendments set out and explained in the attached copy, which also explains the reasons for the amendments. Otirā, e ngā reo, e ngā mana, e ngā waka, e ngā kārangarangatanga maha, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tena koutou. Ki a Ngai Tahu whānui, ki te maunga o Aoraki, te moana Te Wai Pounamu me ō tātau tuāhine---e Whetu, Sandra, tēnā kōrua, tēnā korua me ā koutou mātua, ō koutou tūpuna. E mihi ana ki ngā mema o te komiti mai anō i te 27 o ngā rā o Hūrae 1993, tae noa ki tēnei rā, tēnā koutou i whiriwhiri ai te take nei i mua i te aroaro o Ngai Tahu whānui i ōtautahi, i Kaiapoi, i Hokitika anō. Kāti i tēnei rā kua tutuki ai te kaupapa i whāia ai e Te Poari o Ngai Tahu me te iwi whānui. Ahakoa i tō roatia ngā whakahaere o te komiti me kī, ko ngā kaupapa o te Whare nei i whakaroa ake te whakatinanatanga o tēnei Pire. Nō reira ka huri aku kōrero ki ngā kaiwhakahaere o te Whare nei, kaua koutou e muri atu i tēnei e utaina ki runga i te iwi Māori ēnei āhuatanga. Ki a au nei he mahi taurekareka ki ngā iwi o Ngai Tahu.

speaker: Mr SPEAKER
text: In a moment we will come to the private and local orders of the day and will be discussing the Te Runanga O Ngai Tahu Bill. While it is not provided for in the Standing Orders, the importance of this Bill to a section of the community and the numbers who have chosen to come to Parliament make it appropriate that I should say a few words. Nō reira, e ngā manuhiri tuarangi, ēhara tēnei i te whaikōrero engari he mihi poto rawa atu. E tū ana tēnei i raro i te tikanga Pākehā. Engari ki a koe Tā Tīpene, arā, me ngā rangatira, e ngā whaea, e ngā rangatahi, Ngai Tahu tonu, tēnā rā koutou kua eke mai nei ki tēnei o ō tātau marae te Whare Pāremata. E mōhio ana mātau katoa o te taumaha ki runga i a koutou mai i te tīmatanga o tēnei Pire, ā, tae noa ki nāianei. Nō reira, ko tēnei te mihi, te aroha rawa atu ki a koutou i runga i te āhuatanga o tēnei rā tino mīharo. Tēnā rā koutou, arā, me ngā mate kei runga i a koutou. I tēnei wā ka tū hono ngā mea katoa me kī, haere koutou, haere koutou, haere koutou. Nō reira, tēnā ānō hoki koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon. DOUG KIDD
text: Rau rangatira mā o te Whare Pāremata, tēnā koutou. Ko tēnei Te Pire o Ngai Tahu. Hei tohu tēnei o ngā moemoeā o tēnei iwi o Te Wai Pounamau. He kīnaki tēnei o te rangatiratanga o mua. Engari he kīnaki tino reka mō rātou. Haere ngā mate. Tēnā tātau ngā kanohi ora. Tēnā tātau katoa.

speaker: Hon. WINSTON PETERS
text: E ngā mātua, e ngā karanga maha, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon. DAVID CAYGILL
text: ā, tēnā koutou. Tihei mauri ora! Haere mai e te manuhiri tūārangi. Haere mai ki tēnei marae o tātau. Haere mai Ngai Tahu, ngā tāngata rongonui. Ahakoa he mihi poto tēnei, hei aha ka nui tonu i te aroha. Nō reira e te iwi naumai, haere mai. Tēnā tātau katoa.

speaker: Mr SPEAKER
text: Kia ora rawa atu.

speaker: Hon. ROBYN McDONALD
text: Tēnā koutou e ngā matawaka. Ko Mauo te maunga, ko Tauranga te moana, ko Ngai Terangi te iwi, ko Ngai Tama Whariua te hapu, ko Te Rereatukahia te marae; ko au tēnei e tu mai nei. Nō reira, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon. RICHARD PREBBLE
text: Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora katoa ana tātau---e heke ana.

speaker: ALAMEIN KOPU
text: Karanga Ko te tuatahi me mihi atu au ki te hunga e torona ō rātau tapuwae, e pāoho mai ana i ngā kawenga o tēnei Whare wahine, āe, i nāianei kua whetu rangitia. Noho atu koutou te hunga wairua, te hunga nāna i kitea koutou. Waiho mai mātou te hunga ora, te hunga toa riri ki a mātou. Ko taku mihi tuarua, mō rātou mā i konei e takataka ana, otirā, nā ngā mahi a te wā kua wehe atu ki, a mahi kē. Ko taku mihi tuatoru, ki a koe te Kura Hautū o tēnei Whare Rūnanga. Kāre au e mōhio mehemea ka whakamihi au mōhou i whakakīhia i tō tūnga mānga tiketike, rānei, kia tangi mōhou e pāneine ana i te muri o te ahi. Nō reira, ki a tātau kua mahue mai, tēnā tātau katoa.

speaker: ALAMEIN KOPU
text: Greetings to us gathered here. United we stand; divided we fall. Kei a koe te Kura Hautū, tēnā koe, tēnā tātau, tēnā tātau, tēnā tātau katoa---ka huri!

speaker: ALAMEIN KOPU
text: Karanga Ko te tuatahi me mihi atu au ki te hunga e torona ō rātau tapuwae, e pāoho mai ana i ngā kawenga o tēnei Whare wahine, āe, i nāianei kua whetu rangitia. Noho atu koutou te hunga wairua, te hunga nāna i kitea koutou. Waiho mai mātou te hunga ora, te hunga toa riri ki a mātou. Ko taku mihi tuarua, mō rātou mā i konei e takataka ana, otirā, nā ngā mahi a te wā kua wehe atu ki, a mahi kē. Ko taku mihi tuatoru, ki a koe te Kura Hautū o tēnei Whare Rūnanga. Kāre au e mōhio mehemea ka whakamihi au mōhou i whakakīhia i tō tūnga mānga tiketike, rānei, kia tangi mōhou e pāneine ana i te muri o te ahi. Nō reira, ki a tātau kua mahue mai, tēnā tātau katoa.

speaker: ALAMEIN KOPU
text: Greetings to us gathered here. United we stand; divided we fall. Kei a koe te Kura Hautū, tēnā koe, tēnā tātau, tēnā tātau, tēnā tātau katoa---ka huri!

speaker: Then we have a look at the statement that
text: Tonight I am asking this House to allow us to recognise the footsteps of our early pioneers in order that little children, in Major Waite's words, might live in a sweeter place. Hon. TUARIKI JOHN DELAMERE (Associate Treasurer): Kia hiwa rā, kia hiwa rā! Moea, arā, mahi tū! Moea, arā, ara mahi taua! Ka tiritiriā---ka rere ai a tama ki tōna hiwa! Kia hiwa rā, kia hiwa rā! Kia hiwa rā i tēnā tuku, kia hiwa rā i tēnei tuku, kei wharua koe ki te toto, whakapuru tonu. Whakapuru tonu ngā tai ki Maketu! E tangitia arā nā ngā tai ki Rotorua. Kaōre ko ko au e kimi ana, e hahau ana i ngā piringa, i ngā kokonga hākoakoa. Ka tō te rā ki tua, ka haramai rā ki runga--- ahā, i aha-hā! Whano, whano haramai te toki, haumi e, hui e, tāiki e! E tumuaki kōrero o te Whare nei, tēnā koe! Ko Matarēhua Wikiriwhi, ko Te Kurunga-o-teMārama Waaka, ko te Moana-nui-a-Kiwa Ngārimu, ko Haane Mānahi, ngā tama katoa o Tūmatauenga. E Haane, i ngā wā o mua, i mahi tūkino ngā kaimahi tepu ngaro ki a koe. Nō reira, i tēnei wā i roto i te poho o tēnei Whare teitei, kei te tū ahau ki te tautoko ngā whakaaro atawhai o te take nei. Ki a koutou, ngā mema o te Rōpū Whakamana o Aotearoa, whakamaumaharatia te tama toa o te waka o Te Arawa. Tautokotia taku mahi mō te ture. Tautokotia taku mahi mō te tohu o Wikitōria mō Haane Mānahi.

speaker: SANDRA LEE
text: E ngā iwi, e ngā reo, e ngā hau e whā, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon. MAX BRADFORD
text: E kā rakatira, tēnā koutou! He toaka nui te pounamu. He toaka nui te rakatirataka. He toaka nui hoki te aroha. Kia ora tātou katoa!

speaker: Hon. MAX BRADFORD
text: It is with a great deal of pleasure that I commend these Bills to this House for passage. Mr DOVER SAMUELS (NZ Labour): Tihei mauri ora! E kōrero ana ngā pou takataka, pou āwheowheo E ranga mahunuku, e ranga mahurangi---takoto te hau nō Tū! Takoto te hau nō Tu! Tōia mai te waka! Mā wai e tō te waka? Mā ngā kaiwhakarongo ake puni ngā teina---naumai! Ka whakatau ana kei te toa, ka haere mai te toki--- Hui e, haumi e---taiki e! Te Kaikōrero o te Whare, Mr Speaker, tēnā koe! Nāu nei tēnei Whare 'hakatapu te manuhiri tūārangi karanga i tēnei ata, nā reira, tēnā koe! E te Minita, e Max, tēnā koe! Tēnā hoki koe me wō whakamārama mai i tēnei Pire, tēnei Ture 'hakahirahira e whai nei tātou, e hīkoi nei i roto i ngā kokonga katoa o tēnei Whare. Nō reira, tēnā koe! E waku rangatira, ngā mema o Aotearoa Tuatahi, wāku teina, wāku tuakana, tēnā koutou! E te tuahine whaea, e Sandra, tēnā koe! E ngā mema katoa o te Whare Pāremata e whai nei i tēnei kaupapa tino hōhunu huri ana i tō tātou Whare, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa! Te mea tuatahi māku e te Whare, me kī ake kua hinga tētahi o ngā teina, tama teina o tō tātou tuahine whaea, a Tariana Turia. Hinga i te pō nei! Nō reira, e mihi atu aroha atu ana ki a ia i roto i ngā tikanga tuku waiho o ō tātou mātua tīpuna ki a tātou i raro i te tuanui o tēnei Whare i tēnei ata. Nō reira, hoinō tēnei ngā rangatira e kawe atu ana te aroha ki a ia me tana whānau kua tuku nei i te kapua pōuri i runga i a ia me tana whānau i tēnei rā. Otirā, e mihi ana ki te whānau rangatira---rangatira i roto o Aotearoa, Ngai Tahu, tēnā koutou! Haere mai, haere mai, haere mai! Haere mai ki tēnei rā tino rongonui, mātakitaki mai nei te iwi katoa, te iwi Māori puta noa i Te Waipounamu me Te-Ika-a-Māui. Haere mai, mauria mai tēnei taonga tino tapu hei whaitanga, hei'hakawhititanga, hei'haka manatanga mā tātou i tēnei rā. E hari ana, e koa ana te ngākau kua haere katoa mai ngā kaikōrero, ngā mātenga, te tumuaki o Ngai Tahu whānui tonu me ngā kaitautoko, ngā kūia, ngā kaumātua, te whānau, ngā hapū, ngā kokonga katoa o Te Waipounamu. Nō reira, hoi anō tēnei e mihi tautoko atu ana i te karanga a tō tātou rangatira, tō tātou Kaikōrero mō tēnei Whare, ā, a tō tātou rangatira e noho ake nei---te Speaker. Kore e toroa ake ēnei wāhi pitopito mihi, hoi anō tēnei he tū atu ana ki te'hakatau, ki te tautoko. Kāti rā, me mutu atu ki tēnei wāhi pitopito kōrero āku, i waua kōrero rā anō kua huihui katoa tātou, kua huihui roki wairua mai rātau kua whetūrangitia. Nō reira, i raro i ngā tikanga, ngā kaupapa tuku waiho a wō tātou mātua ki a tātou, hoi anō tēnei he mihi atu ki a koutou. E mihi atu ana hoki ki ō tātou kārangaranga maha, ō tātou tini mate e hinga mai nei, e hinga atu nā---kore e taea te pēhea! Rātau ki a rātau te hunga mate. Piki hono tātai hono, rātou ki a rātou, tātou e pae nei ngā kanohi ora, ngā mahuetanga mai a rātau, e pae nei i raro i te tuanui o tēnei Whare, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora mai anō tātou katoa.

speaker: And also to Donna Awatere Huata
text: e te tuahine tēnā koe, huri ana i tō tātou Whare tēnā koutou, kia ora mai anō tātou katoa!

speaker: Manu Alamein Kopu
text: Kia ora! āe, i kī koe i tērā tau i te 13 o Here-turi-kōkā, i roto i te Whare nei, kei te reri te Kāwanatanga ``ki te puru i ōna moni ki te wāhi kei reira tōna waha.'' He kura kaupapa Māori tuarua kei te rohe o Te Arawa, ā, he tauira kei reira, e tatari ana ki te whakauru engari, a te tau rua mano te kau rā anō ka uru atu. Kei hea ngā rauemi i ōatitia mai e koe?

speaker: Mr DOVER SAMUELS
text: Tēnā koe e te Kaikōrero o te Whare Pāremata. Tihei mauri ora!

speaker: Mr DOVER SAMUELS
text: Kei te kōrero wānanga pou takataka, pou āwhiowhio---naha mangarū raka e māhū rangi, he mahu toa---takoto te hau nō Tū, takoto te hau nō Tu. Ka tōia mai te waka---mā wai e tō te waka? Mā ngā kaiwhakarongo ake, ka puni ngā teina, nau mai haere mai. Pāpaka tō ake nei te tau ka ngahorohia te toki ue-e, hau i-e, tāiki e. He mahi kai takatā, he mahi kai hoa. He mihi atu tēnei ki a Ngāi Tahu, ngā whare katoa, ngā kokonga katoa, ngā pātū katoa o Ngāi Tahu nui tonu. Tēnei rā whakahirahira, tēnei rā nui tonu kua whakatakototia ai te Kerēma mua i te aroaro o te Whare Pāremata. Kua whakatakototia ai te Kerēma a Ngāi Tahu i mua i te aroaro o te Whare Pāremata o Aotearoa. E tino roa ana tēnei wāhanga, tēnei take, tēnei kaupapa e werewere ana i waenganui i a koutou. Nō reira, i roto i ngā mātakitaki whānui hōhunu, kua tae mai koutou i tēnei rā ki te hāpai i te Kerēme, i te kaupapa. Nō reira, hoi anō tēnei e tū atu ana ki te mihi whānui atu ki a koutou katoa, ki ngā pātū, ki ngā whare katoa o Ngāi Tahu.

speaker: TUKOROIRANGI MORGAN
text: Hoi anō, tuatahi ko te whakamihi atu ki a koutou Ngāi Tahu, koutou kua tae ā-tinana mai ki konei ki te Whare Pāremata, tēnei ka mihi atu ki a koutou. Ka pēnei nā āku whakamihi atu i te mea ahakoa piki, heke, ahakoa ngā uauatanga o te wā, kua tae mai koutou. Erā ō koutou, ērā o tātou e whakahē ana i te kaupapa, ā, kia ora katoa ana koutou---Waitaha, koutou, kia ora koutou. E, me pēhea he kōrero māku ki a koutou, hoi anō he rā nui tēnei. He rā nui tēnei. He rā nui tēnei i te mea, ā, kua puta tātou mai i te ao pāhekeheke, ki te ao mārama. Nō reira, Ngāi Tahu tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora katoa ana tātou.

speaker: To use the words of his own language
text: Al President Senor Menem, en representacion de la gente Māori, le doy la bienvenida a Nueva Zelanda, que disfrute su estadia en nuestro pais. Con la esperanza de que esta no sea su ūltima visita. Dios lo bendiga. Ngā mihi aroha nei ki runga i a tātou kua tatū ki runga i te karanga. Kua karangahia nei e tātou a Kai Tahu me Kāti Māmoe me Waitaha. Kai te mihi atu nei ki a koutou, tēnei kaupapa whakahirahira, tapu hoki kei runga i a tātou katoa. E tautoko ana i ngā mihi ki a rātou kua ngaro ki tua o te ārai, ā, ki a tātou hoki e te hunga ora, te hunga kanohi i waihotia nei e rātou. Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou. Ngā mihi hoki nā rātou o te wā kāinga, o Tā Manurihi me Ngati Kahungunu whanui tonu, nā whanauka o Ngāi Tahu. Kia mōhio ai koutou nei, nā rātou o te wā kāinga, te aroha te tautoko mō tēnei pire tino whakahirahira ki runga i a koutou, i a tātou katoa nō reira tēnā koutou e ngā whanauka, e Kai Tahu, tēnā koutou, kia ora tātou.

speaker: The ASSISTANT SPEAKER
text: No, they will get their fair share and we will make certain that they do. Manu Alamein Kopu: E whakapono ana koe te Minita, ko tētahi o ngā take i whati te kaupapa o Te Whakatōhea, kāore te Kāwanatanga i whakaaea kia whakaurua atu taua oati i whakaaeatia i waenganui i te Karauna me Tainui, ōtira, me Ngāi Tahu?

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA
text: Tēnei me tuku atu ngā mihi ki ngā mātua, ngā whaea, ngā whakatipuranga i tae ā-tinana mai ki te whakarongo ki te Pire nei nō reira, Ngai Tahu whānui tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon. TAU HENARE
text: Yes, I believe so. Manu Alamein Kopu: Ka taea e te Minita te whakatūturu mai mehemea ko tēnei te hinonga Kāwanatanga hei kokopi atu i te āputa ōhanga o roto i ngā rohe pērā i te rohe o Mātaatua?

speaker: SANDRA LEE
text: In conclusion, today is another milestone in New Zealand's history. I support the consideration of this report on the Ngai Tahu Claims Settlement Bill. NANAIA MAHUTA (NZ Labour): E ngā mana, e ngā reo, e ngā kāranga maha o Waitaha, Kāti Māmoe, Kai Tahu, tēnei te mihi atu ki a koutou. E mihi kau ake nei ki a koutou me ngā toimahatanga i runga i a koutou ki te whai ake i ngā hua mō ō koutou kaupapa kei mua i a tātou i tēnei wā. Nō reira tēnā tātou katoa.

speaker: Hon. ROGER SOWRY
text: Arrangements for blood testing for diabetes are already in place in the Bay of Plenty and East Coast regions. Medical practitioners have the equipment to test blood sugar levels, and routinely conduct tests whenever they are necessary. Manu Alamein Kopu: I tae au ki tētahi hui a Tūāpapa Ate Kakā i Whakatāne i te 30 o ngā rā o Pipiri. I reira anō hoki a Ahorangi Bob Elliot o te Kura Rongoā o Tāmaki-makau-rau, ā, i reira e kaha ana tana whakahau kia whakamātauria te toto mō te matehaka. Ka whakaae mai anō te Minita ki te whakaaro ka whai hua kē atu te pūtea mō te ate kakā B me te matehuka ki te whakahaere ana kaupapa e rua i te wā kotahi?

speaker: Rt Hon. JENNY SHIPLEY
text: Hei kōrero wānanga poutakataka, pou āwhiowhio. E ranga mahunuku, e ranga mahurangi, takoto te hau nō Tū. Takoto te hau nō Tū, tōia mai te waka. Mā wai e tō te waka? Mā ngā kaiwhakarongo ake puni. Ngā teina, nau mai! Ka whakatau ana kē te toa ka haere mai te toki, hui e, haumi e, tāiki e! E ngā iwi, e ngā reo, e ngā maramara, e ngā tuituinga o Ngai Tahu, e ngā hapū, e ngā whānau, e Ngai Tahu whānui, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa. E ngā tuituinga o Waitaha, o Kāti Māmoe, o ngā iwi o Te Wai Pounamu huri noa ngā kokonga kāinga, ngā kokonga aituā, ngā kokonga maha, ngā kārangaranga maha, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā anō rā tātou katoa. He mihi poto tēnei, he mihi tautoko. He mihi tautoko hoki ki ngā mihi a te Minita a Takarahi Kerēma me tana kaha ki te tū, ki te hautū, ki te āwhina i te kaupapa. Me mihi hoki ki te wahine toa o te motu, a Helen Clark, nāna nei tēnei kaupapa i tautoko mai i te wāhanga houtanga mai ki tēnei Whare Pāremata. Me mihi hoki ki te Pirimia me āna nei kōrero tautoko mai i tēnei kaupapa tino hōhunu, tino hirahira. Ka mau ngā whakaaro ki te tini me te maha, ki ngā kuikuia, ki ngā kaumātua o Waitaha kua pāhi atu ki muri o te ārai. Mai rā anō tēnei kaupapa moemoeā ai e rātou, tēnei moemoeā tino hōhunu. Te tumanako, kei konei rātou katoa, ā rātou wairua ki te hāpai i tēnei rā tino hirahira maumahara ki a Ngai Tahu. Nō reira, e ngā tini mate, nō reira e te whānau pani, nō reira e ngā kaumātua kuikuia, whakarongo mai rā koutou i muri i te ārai. Whakapū mai nei koutou ki te tautoko i te whānau o Ngai Tahu. E karanga ana tēnei ki a koutou, noho mai i waenganui i te whānau. Tēnā koutou katoa. Ka maumahara ki te maunga tapu, te Aoraki, whakaruru mai ana i te iwi, te whānau katoa o Ngai Tahu huri noa. Huri noa, tēnā koutou, tēnā anō hoki tātou katoa.

speaker: Hon. GEORGINA TE HEUHEU
text: E ngā mana, e ngā reo, e te tupuna maunga whanaunga Aoraki, tēnā koutou i tēnei ahiahi miharo.

speaker: TUKOROIRANGI MORGAN
text: ā, kia ora! E ngā rangatira o Ngai Tahu mai i ngā tōpito e whā o Te Wai Pounamu, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā anō tātou katoa.

speaker: TUKOROIRANGI MORGAN
text: Kia ora, e te rangatira, e te kaiwawao i ngā kōrero, ā, otirā kia ora katoa ana tātou, e ngā mema Māori o tēnei Whare---Sandra, Tari, Nanaia, e koro, tātou katoa. Georgina, kei te mihi katoa ana mātou, ahau, ki a tātou katoa. Tuatahi, ki te hoki au ki ngā kōrero mō tē tiriti. I a koe Nanaia e kōrero ana nō te wāhanga o te tiriti, me te wāhanga ki ngā iwi. Koi nā rā te take nāku i kawe te mōtini kia whakaurungia atu te Tiriti o Waitangi ki roto i te wāhanga o tēnei o ngā Pire. Te take i pērā, kua roa mātou e whakarongo ana ki ngā kōrero o tēnā kura, o tēnā iwi, o tēnā hapū, kia whai mana rātou i roto i te Pire nei. Nā reira mātou i whakaae ki te mōtini engari, kīhai te Rōpū Reipā i whakaae. Kei te mihi katoa au ki a Sandra, nāna te tautoko i te wāhanga ki te Tiriti o Waitangi---Sandra, tēnā koe. Kua roa mātou o te Kāwanatanga e whakarongo ana ki a koutou e mea ana, kei whea te wāhanga mō ngā iwi, kei whea te wāhanga mō ngā hapū, ā, koirā i whakaurungia atu te mōtini o te Tiriti o Waitangi ki roto, e hoa. Hei aha? Hei tīmatatanga noa iho tēnei. Mā reira, ka whakawhānuitia atu te titiro ki te katoa o te ture mō ngā mahi mātauranga. Nō reira, tāku e kī nei ki tō tātau iwi e whakarongo mai ana ki tēnei reo irirangi, e meake ana a au, ahakoa tā mātou kaha ki te hari i te mōtini, kīhai i tutuki. Nā te Rōpū Reipa anō i whakahē. Tua atu i tērā, ko ngā whakahē ki te whakatūnga o Te Rūnanganui o nga Kura Kaupapa Māori. Mai rā anō mātou e whakapono ana, kāre kau he rōpū i tua atu i Te Rūnanganui o ngā Kura Kaupapa Māori hei kaitiaki mō te kaupapa o Te Aho Matua nei. Nā rātou i waihanga te kaupapa nei, nā rātau anō i hua te whakaaro, otirā, kua tinana hei kawenata mō ā tātau kura. Nā, kia mōhio mai katoa tātou ko te nuinga o ngā rōpū o ngā kura i tautoko ki Te Aho Matua, ki tēnei o ngā kaupapa o te Pire o Te Aho Matua. Tekau mā tahi anake ngā rōpū i whakahē i te kaupapa nei tekau mā tahi. Ki te hoki tātou ki ngā take Māori, e kore tātau e kotahi kē ki te kotahitanga o ngai tātou. Ahakoa he aha te take---take whenua, take ika, koi rā te āhua o te iwi Māori. E kore tātou e kotahi i roto i ngā take---kotahi katoa nei. Nā reira, o ngā tono i whakatakotoria ki mua i tēnei komiti, ko te nuinga i whakaae ki te kaupapa nei. Ko te tekau mā tahi kāre i whakaae---kāre i whakaae. Nā, ko ētehi o ngā kura, nā runga anō i te pūhaehae, i ngā ngau tuarā i waenganui i a rātou me ētehi o ngā mema kei runga i te rūnanga---i pērā e āhua. Nā runga i ngā ngau tuarā, e hoa! Kāre rātau i te noho Māori mai, ki te kōrero ā-Māori mai! Hoi anō, e ngau tuarā, e ngaungau i a rātou nā te mea he pūhaehae, kua kore rātou e whakaae ki te kaupapa nei. Nā, kei te aroha ake! Kei te aroha ake rā! Ko tātou e taupatupatu ana i a tātou anō. Nā, ka nui rā te whakapono ki te kaupapa nei o Te Aho Matua. I a koe e kōrero ana i tā tāua kuia, Nanaia kei te whakaae katoa au mō ngā kōrero a Rangitaiki e mea ana, ``Tiakihia te reo a tēnā iwi, a tēnā iwi, a tēnā iwi, ahakoa Tainui, ahakoa Ngāti Porou, ahakoa Ngāpuhi, ahakoa ko wai, ahakoa nō whea te reo, tautokohia!''. Ko au tētehi e tautoko kaha ana ki tērā o ngā whakaaro. Engari, ko te Pire nei kāre i te tautoko i te mana o tēnā, o tēnā, o tēnā. Ko te noho o te Pire nei, he noho marara noa iho nei. Kāre i te takahi i tērā, kāre i te pēhi i tērā, kāre i te mea atu ki te Kura o Rākaumanga, kaua koe e whakaako i tō reo Tainui. Nā, ko te Pire, kei te noho pai te Pire. Kei te noho pai te Pire ki tā mātau titiro. Nā, kei te āhua tautoko au ki ngā kōrero a ngā rangatira pēnā tō Barna Heremia mā, e mea ana tukuna atu taku rangatiratanga mō Tainui, māku e kawe i roto i taku rangatiratanga o Tainui. Whakaae katoa ana mātou ki tērā. Nā, ki te titiro tātou ki te Pire nei, ka ura katoa ngā kura pēnā i tō Rākaumanga, ki roto i ngā ōati o te Pire nei. Kāre wā mātou whakahē, āwangawanga rānei mō tērā. Engari e meake ana mātou, kia kaha te tautoko i tēnei Pire, hei aha? Hei whare nui! E mea ana mātou, hei whare nui! Hei poupou mō ngā mahi mātauranga i roto i ngā kura kaupapa Māori. Nā, kua rongo tātou, ko ētehi o ngā kura, kāre e pai ana kia mau tonu te ingoa o te kura kaupapa ki runga i ērā kura kāre i te pūmau ki te kaupapa Te Aho Matua. Kua rongo tātou ki ngā kōrero a Maraenui e kōrero pērā ana---tukuna mātou tō mātou rangatiratanga, engari kauaka koutou e tango i te ingoa o Te Kura Kaupapa o Maraenui. Nā, e mea ana te Minita, ko ngā kura Māori, kura kaupapa Māori anake e pūmau ana te kaupapa o Te Aho Matua, mā rātou anake tēnei ingoa. Koia nā rā te whakaaro a te Minita. Kua roa tātou e kōrero ana---e kī, e kī ko ngā kupa nei, kura kaupapa, nō tātou katoa ahakoa ko wai---ahakoa ko wai! Engari, ko tā ngā kōrero a Pita mā, waiho tēnei mō ngā kura anake e pūmau ana ki Te Aho Matua. Kei te whakaae au nā te mea nā rātau anō i hua te whakaaro, nā rātou i waihanga. Ehara nā tātou te iwi Māori tēnei kaupapa i tuhi, i waituhi, i hanga. Nā, he kaupapa pakeke tērā. Ki te whakaae tātou, kia kaua ngā kura e pūmau ana ki te kaupapa o Te Aho Matua, kia whakakorehia te ingoa o te kura kaupapa ki runga i a rātou---kaupapa pakeke tērā. Engari, kei te tika te Minita, nā te rununga i waihanga te kaupapa nei. Nā, ki te titoro tātou ki ngā Whare Wānanga, kāre e taea e tātou te tango i te kupu, whare wānanga, ka uta ki runga i wā tātou kaupapa i te wā kainga. Nā, hei whakaarotanga mā tātau a ngā rā kei mua i te aroaro. Nā, tua atu i tērā, ko Te Aho Matua nei ki taku titiro, ko te whakatinanatanga tērā o wā tātou tikanga o roto i te ao Māori. Kei tēnā iwi, kei tēnā hapū tōna whakamāoritanga. I roto i a au, i a māua ko Nanaia, nā ko te kaupapa o Tainui. Kāre kau i kō atu i tērā. Engari, pēwhea ngā kura i roto i ngā tāone pēnā i tō Kirikiriroa. Pēwhea ngā kura i roto i ngā tāone pēnā i tō Tāmaki-makau-rau---ko tēwhea te kaupapa ka whakapiri atu mā rātau? Ngāti whātua pea? Tainui rānei? Kāre tātou e mohio ana---kāre tātou e mōhio ana! Ka hoki tātou ki konei Te Upoko o te Ika ? Mā wai e kī atu te Kura o Porirua, ē, me pūmau koutou ki ngā tikanga o Ngāti Toa. Kei reira kē te āwangawanga. Hoi ano ēnei whakaaro hei whakaohooho i a tātou. A ngā rā kei mua i te aroaro ka hoki mai anō tātou ki te kōrero i te take nei. Kotahi anō te kaupapa o te Pire nei, ko te reo Māori kāre kau i kō atu i tērā. Ko te reo Māori me ōna tikanga katoa, tōna whānautanga, tōna hōhonutanga, ko te reo Māori. Nō reira, ka mihi atu au ki ngā kaimahi o tō tātou komiti, e Tū, koutou, tātou i hiki i te kaupapa mai i tōna tīmatatanga, ka tae mai ki tēnei wā---ki te Minita, ki taku tuakana, ki tō tātou tuakana ki a Tau. He kaupapa nui tēnei. He kaupapa nui tēnei kua roa, kua eke ki te tekau tau ngā kura kaupapa e tatari ana kia tinanatia tēnei Pire. Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, ā, kia ora koutou e whakarongo mai ana ki wā tātou kōrero.

speaker: Mr DEPUTY SPEAKER
text: I do not need any assistance. If I do, I will call upon the honourable member. The honourable member who has just risen to his feet is perfectly entitled to speak in Maori if he so wishes. There is no requirement for him to arrange for an interpreter. It is entirely up to the member concerned who has the right, if he or she wishes, to speak in Maori. TUKOROIRANGI MORGAN: Kia hoki anō au ki te Ture 1934-35. Ko tēnei he whakatū i tētehi pūtea kia taea, ahakoa ko wai, te tiki moni mai. Ko tēnei pūtea i raro anō i te Māori Purposes Fund Act. He mea tēnei ki te whakawhānui i te titiro a tēnā iwi, a tēnā poari, a tēnā Rūnunga Kaporeihana Whenua, ki te whakawhāiti i tōna titiro i te āhuatanga me pēhea e taea te whakapakari ake i ngā mahi e mahia ana i runga i aua whenua. Nāna, ko te poari kaiwhakahaere o tēnei rōpū, kua riro mā te Minita Māori a ia, ko ia te heamana. I roto anō i tēnei kaupapa, ko te whakarahi ake i ngā mema Māori, mai i te tokowhā, mai i te tokowhā ki te tokoono.

speaker: Mr DEPUTY SPEAKER
text: For the benefit of the honourable member for Tauranga, it is from four representatives to six. He mea tēnei i te mea kua whakahouhia te ture, kua whakahouhia te ture. Kei te mōhio katoa tātou, tokoono ngā mema Māori a muri mai i te kōwhiringa pōti e tū mai nei---tokoono. Nō reira, nā runga i tērā, kua kite atu te Minita Māori, kāre e kore ka whakawhānui ake te tokowhā ki te tokoono. He mea nui tēnei. Ko te mema o Tauranga e kī ana, i mahue mai, i whakarērea mātou a Tau Hēnare, a Tuariki, ahau i te Rōpū o Aotearoa Tuatahi. Tāku tēnei ki a ia. Te take i wehe atu mātou i te mea kua hōhā katoa mātou ki te whai i ngā whakaaro Pākehā, āna whakaaro Pākehā. Ahakoa hōhā katoa mātou i a ia, i a mātou i roto i te Rōpū Aotearoa Tuatahi, kare ngā mema Māori i hui tahi mātou ngā mema Māori katoa. Kāre mātou i hui mō tētahi take kotahi. Nō reira, i runga anō i te hōhā, i runga anō i te mātou whakapono, kāre i te whai whakaaro ki ngā take Māori he mataku nōna, te mea kē, nā te iwi Pākehā o Tauranga i whakatū i a ia, i whakarērea mātou i te Rōpū o Aotearoa Tuatahi.

speaker: Mr Dover Samuels
text: I raise a point of order, Mr Speaker. Mr DEPUTY SPEAKER: I hope that Mr Samuels' point of order is not regurgitating what we have just been through. Mr Dover Samuels: It is not. Mr DEPUTY SPEAKER: It is not. All right. Mr Dover Samuels: E te kaiwhakahaere o te Whare, tēnei te pātai ki a koe pēnā e mohio ana koe ki ngā kōrero hōhonu a te mema e tū nei ki te kōrero nā te mea, pēnā harakau a ia e mohio ana, a koe e mōhio ana ki te hōhunutanga i roto āna nei kōrero, pēnā e kōrero ana a ia i raro i ngā ture a te kaiwhakahaere a tēnei Whare, kāhore rainei? Koia tēnā taku pātai ki a koe.

speaker: Mr Dover Samuels
text: I raise a point of order, Mr Speaker. That member has just accused Winston Peters of lying to his Maori people. He has just accused the honourable member for Tauranga of lying. My understanding is--Mr SPEAKER: We do not need to have a debate about that. If the member did so, or used words to that effect, then he will withdraw and apologise. If he did not---and I accept his word---he will continue his speech. TUKOROIRANGI MORGAN: Hoi anā e te kaiwawao kua tangohia aku kōrero, me te mea anō ki taua mema, kia ora. Nō reira, kei te haere whakamua. Mō ngā take Māori, kua riro mā ngā mema o tēnā rohe, o tēnā rohe puta noa i te motu hei kawe i runga i te Poari nei. Mea nui tērā kia tokoono ngā mema Māori ki runga i tēnei Poari i te mea i mua, tokowhā noa iho. Kia hoki anō ki te kaupapa o te Wi Pere Trust. Ko te Wi Pere Trust he kaupapa he whakamarahara ana i te kaumātua rongonui o Te Tai Rawhiti, i a Wi Pere. Hei aha? Hei herehere, hei whakatōpū i ngā āhuatanga i ngā mahi katoa o roto anō i tōna rohe, hei aha? Hei oranga mō tana iwi, hei oranga mō tana iwi. Tua atu i tērā, ko te trust i whakatūhia mō ngā hōia Māori. Ko tēnei kaupapa e whakamahara ana mō ngā hōia Māori. Ko tēnei kaupapa e whakamahara ana mō ngā hōia i uru atu ki te koha a te kaumātua nei a Tā Apirana Ngata i whakatuhia tēnei take hei maramara mō ngā take i Te Tai Rawhiti. E te kaiwawao, kei te mahara katoa mātou, kei te whakaae katoa mātou ngā mema Mema Māori ki ngā kōrero e kī ana ``E tipu e rea mō ngā rā o tōu ao, ko tō ringa ki ngā rākau a te Pākehā hei oranga mō tō tinana.'' Koi nei ngā ōhākī i waihotia e tō mātou tupuna a Apirana, hei ōhākī mō te uri whakatupu. Nō reira kei te anga whakamua. E te Minita Māori, a Tau Henare, nāna i kawe atu tēnei Pire ki roto i te Whare---kaupapa nui tēnei i te mea, nā te Rōpū Reipa anō i tīmata, nā rātou i tīmata kāre i oti, kāre i oti! Kua mahue mai ko te Minita tēnei kaupapa e kawe ki roto i te Whare, hei aha? Hei herehere. Kia oti katoa ngā āhuatanga o te Pire nei, o ngā ture nei, māna e herehere. Nō reira, kua hōha katoa ahau ki te whakarongo ki a koe Dover e pahupahu ana i roto i te Whare nei i te āhuatanga o ngā kaupapa e heria nei tēnei o tātou. Kei te hē tēnā! Kei te hē tērā i te mea, nā runga anō i tana kaha, kua uru mai tēnei kaupapa ki konei. Kua ura mai tēnei kaupapa. A koe, a koe, kei te moemoeā tonu koe. Kei te moemoeā tonu koe, kōrua. Kei te moemoeā tonu koe, e moemoeā tonu ana koe a te tau e tū mai nei, nō reira e koro, pai ana. Kei te haramai tō wā, kei te haramai tō wā! Kei te mōhio katoa tātou, i whakarērea te iwi Māori e te Rōpū Reipa i tērā atu o ngā kōwhiringa pōtī. E whea mano, e whaea mano, e whea manō ngā Māori i whakarērea e koutou. I runga anō i ngā tinihanga, i ngā mahi i mahia e rātou i ngā tau ki muri, i kitea rātou. Nā, i tā koutou kaha ngoikore, tā koutou kaha māngere, nā reira i pōti mai mō mātou. Nā reira i poti mai mō mātou, nō reira, ka pērā. Ka pērā te tau e tū mai nei, ka pērā te tau e tū mai nei. Hāunga anō te mema o Tauranga, haere rā! Ka kite anō! E kore e hoki mai a te Nōema e tū mai nei! Nō reira kei te pai, kei te pai, kei te pai!
