Hoi anō tēnei e karanga atu ki a koutou e ngā mema, e Dover, kia whakakotahihia tātou i roto i te ture nei, i roto i ngā Pire nei, kia hereherehia katoa ngā wāhi kāore i oti. Tēnā koutou!

speaker: Mr SPEAKER
text: Nō reira ki a koutou anō, mehemea e hiahia ana koutou ki te puta mai o tātou nei reo i roto i tēnei Whare, waihotia mā tātou hei tika i ō tātou nei kōrero i mua i ō tātou nei hoa i roto i tēnei Whare Pāremata, hei aha? Hei oranga mō ō tātou nei iwi Māori. Nō reira tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Mr Dover Samuels
text: I raise a point of order, Mr Chairperson. E tū atu ana au ki te 'hakahē i ngā kōrero a te mema, e kōrero nei i āna nei kōrero.

speaker: Mr Dover Samuels
text: At this time I want to say to Tukoroirangi that New Zealand First does support Te Aho Matua---tēnei Pire. Nā, e karanga ana nei rātou nei o te Rūnanga nei kia tautokona te Pire nei, ā, kia mōhio ai tātou nā rātou nei tēnei rōpū nei tautoko ana te kaupapa whakaharahara, kua whārikihia nei e tātou.

speaker: Mr Dover Samuels
text: Obviously not, then. I think that we should all be supporting this Bill for one reason and one reason alone---because it is about kaupapa Maori, it is kaupapa Maori, and if people have trouble understanding that, and if people have trouble with Te Aho Matua, they must also realise that section 156 of the Education Act allows people to establish any other sort of school; it allows that to happen. Te Aho Matua does not stop any other person from establishing any other school that they want to or any other educational institution that they want to. All Te Aho Matua does is whakamana ngā kura kaupapa Māori i raro i a Te Aho Matua. That is how I understand it, and that is how I and my colleague Tukoroirangi Morgan have understood it for the last 10 years or so. That is how our kids have understood it since the establishment at Hoani Waititi Marae of Te Kura Kaupapa o Hoani Waititi. It is not a Bill that would threaten the livelihood of any iwi, any hapu, or any whanau. In fact, I think that it has the opposite effect. I think the Bill has the effect of saying to our people: ``This is yours. This is your tikanga. It belongs to you and you can go about your business within all of that feeling proud, feeling respected, and all those sorts of things.'', which I must admit our people have not felt for a long, long time. I take issue with Mr Joe Hawke's comments about whether this is all Mauri Pacific can do. For a party that has been established for less than 8 months, I think that we have done a helluva job. The member can say what he likes but, at the end of the day, it was this side that was willing to talk about Te Aho Matua, that was willing to take on the korero from te runanga, and it was this side of the House that had the opportunity to put it before the House. We have done our job, and I am very proud of that. So nothing that Mr Hawke says, which tries to denigrate the work of the Mauri Pacific members, will even put me off. What we do today is for all of our mokopuna and all our mokopuna to come. I will be quite glad to go home and sleep at night and think: ``Hey, we did something for our children.'' If the member does not like it, then too bad. He can take another call and ramble on all he likes. Mr DOVER SAMUELS (NZ Labour): Kia ora tātou. Hoi anō tēnei te mea tuatahi māku e mihi atu ana ki a koe e te Heamana, ā, ki a koutou katoa ngā rangatahi, me ngā rōpū atawhai, ngā whaea, ngā kaiako o tēnā ō tātou kura kauapapa. Nō reira, e mihi atu ana ki a koutou, haere mai, nau mai, piki mai. Te mea tuatuai māku, ka puta ngā kōrero a Tuku mō tō tātou reo rangatira, mō ngā mema o te Whare Pāremata e tū atu nei te mihi atu ki a koutou ki te whakawhitiwhiti kōrero mō tēnei Pire, ēnei kaupapa. I roto o āna nei kōrero, te mea tika kē mā mātou, mātou katoa---tū ki te kōrero Māori, tō tātou reo rangatira. Harakau matau whakakāhore ana tērā engari, e tautoko ana i tērā karanga a tēnei ō wā mātau mema. Engari ka puta āna nei kōrero kei te hamahama mai tēnei o wana mema Māori i tēnei taha me tērā atu taha. Ko āku nei whakautu ki a ia, harakau te Minita tū ki te whakahou tēnei Pire i roto o tana reo Māori. Harakau te Minita tū ki te whakahou i tēnei Pire i roto o tana reo Māori harakau te Minita tū ki te whakahou i tēnei Pire i roto o te Whare Pāremata, i roto i tō tātou reo rangatira. He aha te take, kōrero mai ai ia āna nei kōrero 'hakapae. Nā te Minita tēnei Pire e whakahou mai i roto i tēnei Whare, te Whare Pāremata, arā, tēnei wā hei w'akawhitiwhiti kōrerotanga mā tātou. Nā wai i whakahou i tēnei Pire, nā te tahi atu, nā wai i whakahou i tēnei Pire, nā, te tahi atu, nā wai raini? Nā tō tātou Minita Māori! Harakau a ia tū i roto i te reo rangatira, whakahou mai ai i tēnei Pire. Nā, ka kite tātou katoa i roto i ngā nekeneketanga mahia hāriakēhi. E harakau ēnei kōrero, e kōrero wairua tūturu. Engari kei te tautoko! Kei te tautoko mātou katoa, hākoa tō tātou whaea, tuahine e noho nei, nā te mea i roto a ia i ngā 'hakanekeneketanga, 'hakawhitiwhiti kōrero i ngā huihuitanga katoa. Harakau te Minita i tae mai. Harakau te Minita tae mai ki ngā huihuitanga mō tēnei take. Engari, noho nei tō tātou whaea, tō tātou tuahine. Hakoa āna nei rere kē mō te kaupapa o ngā 'hakanekeneketanga i roto i tēnei Pire---kei konei tana wairua, kei konei tana wairua. Ko tēnei te tahi wairua, e Tau. Tāku nei kōrero ki a koe e kōrero nei tāua mō Te Aho Matua te whiriwhiritanga o Te Ahu Matua. Tēnā mea Te Aho Matua, pēnei i te kupenga nei. Mēnā koe e mōhio ana te kupenga o Te Aho Matua, ko te matua herehere ngā kupenga katoa, hei kupenga whānui. Nā, koia tēnā te hōhunutanga o tēnei kupu, Te Aho Matua, hei pupuri, hei pupuri i ngā kaupapa Māori ko tohungia i raro i Te Aho Matua me āna nei tikanga katoa. Nā koia tēnā te kupu tino hōhunu, Te Aho Matua. He aha ngā kupenga ō tātou tamariki mokopuna? Nā, Te Aho Matua nei ko tēnei te Matua a Aho hei kaiherehere i ngā mokopuna, tamariki katoa i raro i te kaupapa tuku iho ō tātou mātua tūpuna ki a tātou. Enei āhua kupu tikanga, he tikanga tūturu tuku iho e ō tātou mātua tūpuna he aha? Kia tū mataara ai ō tātou tamariki i te taha o ngā kura a tauiwi koi tēnā te take! E mōhio ana koe Tau? Mōhio ana ngā mema katoa o tēnei Whare Pāremata, e hamahamangia ana ā tātou tauira, ā tātou kura mokopuna, ā tātau kura Māori me ā tātau kura Māori me ā tātau kōhanga reo me ngā kura Māori katoa. Ka haere mai te kaiwhakawā a te Kawanatanga, arā, te ERO. Ki te hamahama i ā tātou. Nā, ka tū mataara tēnei rōpū te kura kaupapa Māori, te runanga o puta noa o te motu. Kia kaha, kia manawa nui! Engari, kaua e ōrite ki a mātou e werowero nei i a mātou, e whakaiti nei tō tātou reo rangatira. Kaua pēnā koutou! Kaua koutou pēnā te whakaiti i tō tātou reo rangatira. Mauria ngā kaupapa tūturu o tātou mātua tūpuna, mauria hei rongonui mai mō te iwi whānui, kia tū mataara ai koutou i te wā e wāke ai te wāke o te whenua, hīkoi ai te mata o te whenua kia tū mataara ai koutou. Wāku nei kōrero ki a koe e te Minita, kia rangimārie. Kia rangimārie. Tēnā pea māu tō hoa a Tuku he rangimārie, kia tika ai, kia nganga ai ngā korero ki te wāhanga tika. Nā te mea tēnei kaupapa, he kaupapa hōhonu e Tau---a ngā kaiwhiriwhiri, ngā tauira haere mai ki te whakaatu mai i a rātou whakaaro i roto i a mātua huihuitanga, e tū mataara ana. E tū ana i roto i te rangimārie, e tū ana ki te whakaatu mai ki a mātou ngā tikanga katoa, ngā painga, ngā pikitanga, ngā heketanga i roto i tēnei kaupapa, arā, e rapu nei rātou he oranga mō rātou, arā, te mātauranga. Nō reira e Tau, tēnā koe. Te heamana, Mr Chairman, ahakoa ēnei āwangawanga e pā ana ki a tāua, tēnā koe. Kia ora mai tātou.

speaker: Hon. KATHERINE O'REGAN
text: I want to pay due regard to my parliamentary colleagues, and my brother-in-law the member for Te Tai Hauauru. Even before I came on the scene he put his daughter and his kids through kohanga and through the first kura kaupapa Maori in this country. My brother-in-law and his wife have certainly shown commitment to the kaupapa, for their children and also for the vision that kura kaupapa has for our young people and for so many generations to come for this nation. I want to pay my respects and express my gratitude to my National Party colleagues. It was not so long ago that I would balk at calling them my colleagues and friends. I say this from the deepest part of my heart, to my colleagues in the National Party who wondered what the hell this Minister was up to. They wondered to themselves: ``What's this fella going on about?''. They had the faith and the trust to run with the idea and the explanation, and give me, us, and the idea a shot. But they also must have wondered about a whole range of things in the passage of the Bill from here to the select committee, and from the select committee back to the House. I believe that I have, and we have, right throughout the House kept the integrity of the idea and the kaupapa of Te Aho Matua. I want to thank every member of the House who has had a say, whether it was in a negative or a positive stance, and whether it was yes or no. I still do not believe we really realise what we are achieving here tonight. To some of us it may be just another Bill, just another piece of legislation, but it is more than that. It is a way of life for some of our community. It is a way of life that they live 24 hours a day, not just 5 minutes a day, or not just 10 minutes a day. For 24 hours a day they live Te Aho Matua. It is a recognition of the commitment of those people and their vision that we are doing what we are doing here today in passing this piece of legislation. I do not want to ramble on, but I do believe that it is such an occasion that I have to try to think of all those people who have gone before us. I want to name a couple of people who have gone before us: Tweenie Hakaria from the Hoani Waititi Marae and Don Rameka. They are not with us any more, but they were the catalysts. People like Donna Awatere Huata's father are the catalysts. My greatgrandfather was a catalyst. They are all catalysts of an idea that has finally been recognised in this House. I say that with all humility. When I think of the speeches made in this House by people like Ngata and Buck, I think they would have been as proud as punch to have heard the discussion that has gone on today. They will be saying to themselves: ``Look at those people in there. What a great job they have done. We weren't able to do that, but maybe we didn't need to in those days.'' But boy, as sure as hell we need to do it now. Again I congratulate all those people who have had a hand, a fingernail, or even a thought in this idea. It is a wonderful occasion, and I congratulate everybody who has been involved. NANAIA MAHUTA (NZ Labour): E te tumuaki, tēnā koe. Tuatahi, ka mihi atu rā ki ngā maunga kōrero me ngā wae tapu kua tae mai nei i roto i tēnei Whare. Ka mihi nui atu rā ki a koutou, ngā mema o Te Rūnanganui o ngā Kura Kaupapa Māori, ngā tumuaki o ō tātou kura kaupapa katoa puta noa, ā, ki ō tātou nei mema i roto i tēnei Whare, tēnā koutou, tēnā kuotou, tēnā koutou katoa. Ka huri au ki ngā kōrero i waihotia e tētehi o tōku tupuna i tōna wā i kī ake: ``Ahakoa ngā mano huri atu ki te taha hāmariatanga, mahue mai ki ahau kotahi mano, rima rau, rima tekau, tekau mā rua ko ahau kei roto. Ko Te Atua tōku piringa, ka puta, ka ora.'' I tū au i raro i ērā kupu nā te mea kua rongo mai koutou katoa ngā āhuatanga mō tēnei Pire, e kia nei mō Te Aho Matua. I tū au i raro i ngā kupu o tōku tūpuna. Nāna i waihotia hei ārahi i a matou, ā, me whai ake te huarahi tika hei aha? Hei oranga mō ō tātou iwi katoa puta noa. I tū au i raro i ērā kupu nā te mea, nāna te kī ko Te Atua tōku piringa ka puta, ka ora. Koia nā tōna aho matua. Koi nā te tikanga ō mātou, o te kainga, hei whai i raro i ērā whakaaro hei ārahi i a mātou. Nō reira ka mihi atu rā ki a tātou katoa, mō tēnei take. Kaua e pāpōuri mai ki ēnei kōrero nā te mea e mōhiō ana koutou katoa te kiko o tōku nei kōrero me te take kāre au e tino tautoko te Pire nei. Ko te tino take kāre au e tautoko nā te mea, ko tēnei Pire hei whakaturengia i tētehi taonga ki ōku nei whakaaro. Ko tērā taonga e kīa nei ko Te Aho Matua. Kua rongo mai tātou katoa ngā kōrero, ngā taupatupatu, ngā tautohehohe kua puta mai i waenganui i a tātou katoa. Nā tātou anō i ngau i a tātou i roto i tēnei Whare. Koia nā te take kāre au e tino hiahia te whakaturengia tēnei kaupapa nā te mea e mōhio ana ahau mēnā ka whakaturengia, ka whakawehewehe tātou i a tātou. E mōhio ana ahau he aha ngā kōrero o ō tātou kura kaupapa nā te mea, e hiahia ana tātou katoa ki te tautoko ō tātou nei whakatupuranga mē ō rātou oranga i roto i ō tātou nei kura kia whakapakari i a rātou, kia mōhio ai ko wai rātou, nō whea, ā, he aha te tikangā mō ō rātou tūnga i roto i tēnei ao hurihuri. E tika ana, ko tēnei ao he ao hurihuri mō tātou katoa te iwi Māori. Kua kite mai rātou te iwi katoa o tēnei motu ngā mema Māori i roto i tēnei Whare Paremata. Koina te wā tuatahi hei whakatīkingia tēnei Whare kia mōhio ai ngā take katoa i waenganui i a tātou. Ahakoa kāore au i whakaaetia tēnei Pire, e tautoko ana ahau i ngā kaupapa i roto i ō tātou nei kura kaupapa Māori. E tautoko ana ahau ngā whānau hei whāwhā, hei manaaki, hei tiaki i ō tātou nei tamariki i roto i te kura kaupapa. E tautoko ana ahau ngā kōrero o ō tātou nei mātua. Mehemea e hiahia ana koutou i roto i te Whare Pāremata ki te tautoko i a mātou nō te kāinga, tautoko ā-pūtea. Hōmai ngā pūtea kia whakakīk*ngia te whare pukapuka, ki te hoko i ngā rorohiko. Koia nā ngā kōrero o ō tātou nei whanaunga i whakahaere i ngā kura kaupapa Māori. Kāre tēnei Pire hei tautoko ērā o ngā wawata o ō tātou nei whānau. Engari, e tika ana ngā kōrero o te Minita. He roa ake te wā mā tātou katoa ki te tirohia i ngā kaupapa i roto i ō tātou nei kura kaupapa Māori. Kua tae ki te wā ināianei, tika, tika! Ka mihi atu rā ki a ia nā te mea, nānā e whakaputa te whakaaro i waenganui i a tātou. Engari, kei te mau tonu ahau ki ngā nawe o te kāinga, i ngā ngau o te ate. Nā rātou te kī, kaua e tukuna i a mātou kei waho. Kei raro katoa tātou i te kaupapa o ō tātou nei kura kaupapa Māori. Koinā, nā rātou te kī, ehara nāku te kī, nāku anō. Ka hoki atu au ki ngā kōrero o ō tātou mātua tūpuna. Mehemea e hia unu te tangata whāngai Mehemea e hia kai ana te tangata, whāngai. Mehemea e hia moe ana te tangata, whāngaia. Whāngai, manaakitia te tangata. Te titiro anō ki tēnei Pire te whakawehe i a tātou. Koinā ngā whakaaro i noho ki tōku puku nā te mea, mehemea hei whakawehe i ētehi o ō tātou nei kura, ka aha? He aha ngā huarahi mā rātou? He aha? Nā wai e kī, āe, he kaupapa tino pai rātou? Mā tātou te kāwanatanga hei tautoko? Kare tēnei kāwanatanga hei tukuna ngā whakautu mō ētehi o ngā pātai e pā ana ki ngā kura i noho kei waho. Koi nā ngā take i tukuna mai i mua i a tātou. I whakatakotongia mā tātou anō hei titiro, hei whiriwhiri ō tātou nei whakaaro, ka whakautu ki a rātou kei waho. Engari kāre i puta i tēnei wā ngā whākau mō ratou. E tautoko ana ahau ngā tono a tōku tuakana a Tariana. Nāna te kī mehemea e hiahia ana tātou ki te tautoko i Te Runanga o ngā Kura Kaupapa me te take o Te Aho Matua, me te taonga o Te Aho Matua whakaingoata mā rātou ngā kaitiaki. E tautoko ana ahau i tōna kōrero. E tautoko ana ahau hoki ngā kōrero a Trevor Mallard. Nāna te kī mehemea e hiahia ana tātou te tautoko te Tiriti o Waitangi, whakaturengia i roto i te Tiriti o Waitangi, whakaturengia i roto i te Ture katoa mō ō tātou nei tamariki Māori. Nā te Rōpū Reipa ngā kōrero ngā tono mō aua take. Nā tātou te whakaaro, āe, koi nei huarahi tika mō tēnei wāhanga o te Pire. Nā, te Rōpū Reipa e tautoko ana ngā kura kaupapa Māori katoa puta noa mai te Murihiku tae atu ki te Muriwhenua. E tautoko ana tēnei Rōpū Reipa i ngā kaupapa o ō tātou nei tamariki i roto i ngā kura kaupapa Māori me ngā kura tuatahi, tuarua hoki. E mohio ana tātou ko te nuinga o ō tātou nei tamariki i roto i ngā kura tuatahi, tuarua hoki. Me pēwhea te huarahi mā rātou? āe, tika ana te Minita. Ehara tēnei Pire te rongoā mō ērā kaupapa. Engari, e tika ana me whakaputangia ēnei kōrero nā te mea, e tautoko ana te Rōpū Reipa i te mātauranga o ō tātou tamariki. E hiahia tātou ki te panga atu rātou. Nā rātou te ao! E tika ana ngā kōrero, ko te manu kai i te ngahere, ko te manu e kai i te miro nōna te ngahere. Ko te manu e kai te mātauranga nōna te ao. E tika ana ngā kōrero! E tautoko ana mātou katoa, ngā mema o te Rōpū Reipa aua kōrero nā te mea, nā ō tātou tamariki te ao. Nō reira, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Mr SPEAKER
text: Engari ko te whakataukī mō mātou, mō tātou tēnei: ``Ko au te taupā e wehe ai ko te whakatinana o te moemoeā.'' Nā reira e te tumuaki ka nui te mihi.

speaker: TARIANA TURIA
text: Currently, about 5.6 percent of the total land mass in this country is Maori land. Tautoko nui ana tēnei kaupapa i ngā tōpita e whā o te motu nei. I karangahia ai ngā hui-āwhanau, ngā hui-ā-hapu, ngā hui-ā-iwi kia kōrero te take nei, kia whakatūhia tētehi ara kia taea e Māori mā te hīkoi i runga i te ara tika.

speaker: TUKOROIRANGI MORGAN
text: Kia ora e te tuakana, tēnā koe. Tātou e noho nei i roto i te ana o ngā raiona, tātou, kei ngā rangatira o Ngāti Tūrangitukua, ko Taupō te moana, ko Tongariro te maunga, ko te Heuheu te tangata, nau mai, haere mai, nau mai. Haere mai ki tēnei o ngā Whare ki te whakamana i tā koutou hiahia, te taha ki ngā nawe, ngā auwē a te iwi, ā, ngā hāora tata nei kei mua i a tātou, ka mana, ka whakaturehia hei ōhākī, hei taonga mō te motu nei.

speaker: Douglas Graham to try to resolve the wrongs of the past. I say to him
text: ``Kia ora, ka nui rā te mihi atu a koe.

speaker: Mr DOVER SAMUELS
text: E tū atu ki te mihi tautoko atu tēnei koha ki a koe, te Minita, e Takarahi. Kei te mihi atu ki a koe. Mihi aroha atu ki a koe mō tēnei wehenga āu i o tēnei Whare. Ngā mihi aroha o te iwi Māori, ngā mema Māori o te Whare Pāremata. Kei te tū ki te tautoko atu i te Minita, tō tātou Minita nāna nei tēnei taonga i whakatakoto i mua i a koe. Nō reira, haere atu, haere atu i runga i te rangimārie, haere atu i runga i te aroha o te iwi Māori puta noa i Aotearoa. Nō reira, tēnā koe, haere, haere, haere. Kia ora mai anō tātou katoa.

speaker: Mr SPEAKER
text: Thank you, Mr Speaker. Waiata WILLIE JACKSON (The Alliance): I second the motion that a respectful address be presented to His Excellency the Governor-General, in reply to His Excellency's speech. A, tihei mauri ora! E tika tuatahi ki te mihi ki tō tātou Matua i te rangi nāna nei ngā mea katoa. Ka mihi ki te Whare me Papa-tū-ā-Nuku, tēnā kōrua. Ki ngā mate haere. Ki te wairua o taku pāpā noho mai rā ki roto i te ringa o te Atua. Ki te Kaikōrero, tēnā koe. Ki te Pirimia, ahakoa kua ngaro ia, tēnā koe. ā, ki aku rangatira, Jim, Sandra, tēnā korua. Ki ngā whanaunga, ngā hoa i haramai nei ki te tautoko, tēnā koutou. Ki a koe Mita, kua ngaro hoki ia engari, ngā mihi, ngā manaaki ki a koe, Mita. Ki a koutou katoa ngā mema, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā anō tātou katoa.

speaker: GEORGINA TE HEUHEU
text: I only hope that I can meet the expectations of my people. Aroha ki a koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora huihui mai rā tātou katoa.

speaker: RICHARD WORTH
text: The wind blows. Ka piko a te iwi. Ka mutu riri o te 'au, ka tū anō.

speaker: Hon. PAREKURA HOROMIA
text: E mōhio ana tātou te āhua o te mātauranga Māori kei a tātou anake te mita me te kiko. Ki te noho tata a te whānau whānui, ka pai kē te haere o te mātauranga.

speaker: Mita Ririnui
text: Hoi anō Mr Speaker māku e tū ki te whakamārama i ngā kōrero o te tangata nei i tuku atu nei ki a koe, me te tangata keo tō taha. Ko tā kōrero te mema mō Hauraki ko wai koe tēnei wahine ki te tū ki te whakatakahia nei i a mātau ngā mema Māori i roto i te Kāwanatanga.

speaker: Dianne Yates
text: Hoi anō rā ahu atu i konā, ā, kua oti rā ngā kōrero. Nō reira kai te Kaikōrero, tēnā koe, otirā tēnā tātou.

Mr Speaker took the chair at 2 p.m. Prayers. PERSONAL EXPLANATION---ALLEGATIONS Hon. DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of Māori Affairs): I seek leave to make a personal explanation under Standing Order 343 concerning allegations that have been made against me personally. E ngā iwi, e ngā reo, e ngā kārangaranga maha--ko Whakarāra te maunga, ko Ngāti Kurī te hapū, ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Ngāpuhi te iwi--tihē mauri ora! I te pō nā ka hoki mai hau ki te Whare Pāremata muri mai te hui mate o te whaea o Ngāti Hine. I taku taenga mai, ka hōmaingia te Pirimia tētahi pānui ki a au me ngā rārangi hakapae a te rangatira o ACT, a Richard Prebble me wāna whakapae, aku mahi kikino i ngā wā ki muri. E ngā iwi, e ngā reo, ko tēnei taku whakautu ki a ia nā te mea, ana tumanako ki te whakaiti i ahau me taku whānau, me taku hapū, me Ngāpuhi nui tonu. E ngā iwi, e ngā reo, e ngā kārangaranga maha whakarongo mai, whakarongo mai! Tēnei rōpū, tēnei tangata, he tangata whakaiti i a ngāi Tāua te iwi Māori, puta noa. I tēnei wā kua maringa mai wana ruaki ki runga i ahau me taku whānau, me taku iwi, me taku hapū. Taku kōrero ki a ia, a te wā kei te haere mai me huri anō a ia ki te kai i wana ruaki.

speaker: MITA RIRINUI
text: ā, nō reira kei te kaihautū e tū tēnei ki te whakaatu ki te Whare nei, kei te puta atu nei mātou ngā mema Māori ki waho, ki te tautoko ake tō rātou rangatira nāna kua kōrerohia nei ōna āhuatanga, ā, mā tō kaiwhakamārama hei kōrero.

speaker: MARK PECK
text: Koia rā te kaupapa o tēnei kōrero. Koia rā te kaupapa o tēnei kōrero.

speaker: MARK PECK
text: Hoi anō rā kia tau te rangimārie ki a tātou. Hoi anō rā e tika ana kia kōrero pēnā.

speaker: Hon. PAREKURA HOROMIA
text: Ko te huarahi matua e whakatairanga ai te Kāwanatanga i te reo Māori, ko te tautoko i ngā whakahaere e whakaako ana i te tangata ki te reo. Ko te kōhanga reo tēnā, ko te kura kaupapa Māori tēnā, ko ngā wānanga anō hoki tēnā.

speaker: Mahara Okeroa
text: He aha kē ngā mahi o Te Māngai Pāho?

speaker: Hon. PAREKURA HOROMIA
text: Kei Te Māngai Pāho tētahi atu wāhanga o ngā mahi a te Kāwanatanga hei whakatairanga i te reo. Ko tāna mahi he tohatoha pūtea hei hāngaia mai, hei whakaari reo Māori, hei whakapāho i te pouaka whakaata, i te reo irirangai anō hoki.

speaker: Mark Peck
text: I conclude my delivery--- Te Aotearoa Tuatahi, tēnā koutou!

speaker: JOHN TAMIHERE
text: Tēnā rā koe te Kaihautū, te kaiwhakaruruhau i a mātou, tēnā koe. ā, nō reira koutou kia ora huihui mai rā tātou katoa. Kei te mihi nunui ki a koutou te Waiāriki whānui. ā, kaua e wareware ki a mātou mō te mahi whakapae te tangata Prebble, mō te Rōpū Act, kaua e wareware ki a mātou.

speaker: Mr DEPUTY SPEAKER
text: Order. Can I just say that unfortunately there is a bit of feedback coming through on the sound system. Hon. Richard Prebble: I raise a point of order, Mr Speaker. The House should accept the translation by the member. Mr DEPUTY SPEAKER: Of course it will accept the member's translation. We thought the problem with the sound system in the House had been fixed, but we have not fixed it. Because of the interference that is coming through the system, could the member give a translation himself? MITA RIRINUI: Hoi anō mā te wā. Hoi anō koutou rā ngā mema o te kaunihera, ngā mema hōnore, ā, me ngā rangatira katoa o ngā waka o te rohe o te Waiāriki, tēnā koutou, tēna koutou, tēnā koutou. Tēnei rā tā koutou mema kua tū whakaiti nei ki mua ki a koutou i roto i te Whare nei hei whakamihi atu ki a koutou, ahakoa rā e hē ana te tikanga rā mā te pōtiki hei mihi ki a koutou. Nō reira, hoi anō rā, kua kite ā-kanohi rā koutou i ngā āhuatanga, i ngā tū momo wero o te Whare nei i tēnei wā. Hoi anō tāku ki a koutou, kei te noho mai rā tō koutou mema i runga i te ngākau māhaki, i runga i te ngākau mārie, kia kore rā i ngā wero o te ao tangata e puta mai rā i roto i tōku ngākau, nō reira tēnā koutou. Kei aku pāpā, kei aku whaea, nā koutou tonu te pire i whakaahua. Mā te wā tonu ka puāwai āna hua, āna ritenga katoa. Nō reira, Te Arawa, Tākitimu, Mātaatua, Horouta, ngā iwi katoa kua tae mai, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon. TARIANA TURIA
text: Tēnā koutou ngā uri o Pouākani. Tēnā koutou e kaha nei ki te whai i te tika kia ea ai, kia tūtuki ā koutou pono mō ō koutou whenua, tēnā koutou.

Kua mihi ahau ki te Minita i tū mai nei nā te mea, kua whakawhānuitia atu e ia tana kōrero e pā ana ki ngā ahuatanga o te Pire. Nā, he mihi poto tēnei na te mea, kua haere te waewae o te kaumātua rā engari, ko taku hiahia kia tū tautoko ahau i ngā āhuatanga katoa o tēnei pire. Nō reira, ka mihi atu hoki ahau ki tērā pito nā te mea i a mātou nei e noho tahi ana, ka whakaae te katoa o te komiti ki ngā āhuatanga rangatira o tēnei pire.

speaker: Hon. DOUG KIDD
text: Perhaps I could go a bit further than that. The people of the Marutūāhu Confederation, which is the eponymous ancestor of the tribes I mentioned, come from the Tainui canoe. Nō reira, kei te mihi nunui te uri o te waka Te Arawa mō Ngāti Hei, mō Ngāti Huarere. Kei te mihi nunui ki te waka Mātaatua kei Ngāti Pūkenga me Whakatōhea. Nō reira mōhio ki a koutou. ā, kei te mihi nunui ki te whānui i roto o te uri o Porouāriki o Ngāti Porou whānui ki Hauraki.

speaker: Hon. PAREKURA HOROMIA
text: Mā tātou e matatau ana i roto i tō tātou reo rangatira, mā rātou te Māori kāore e matatau ana i roto i te reo, ā, mā te hunga Pākehā e whakaaro ana, e kaingākau ana i ngā take o Aotearoa.

speaker: The CHAIRPERSON
text: I say to the honourable member that that may well be the protocol on the marae, or of iwi or hapū, but in this Chamber we have certain Standing Orders and Speakers' rulings that are obeyed by all members. Hon. PAREKURA HOROMIA: Tēnā koe. Mihi ake anō i a koe e te Tiamana, ahakoa tērā anō te matemate o te āhua o te tikanga, kōrerotia ake anō tātou mō te tiriti, kei te tū ake anō i tērā. E mihi ake anō i a koe.

speaker: Hon. DOVER SAMUELS
text: Hūtia te rito o te harakeke, māku e kī atu ki a koe, he aha te mea nui? Māu e kī mai ki mai ki a au, he tangata, he tangata, he tangata. Rip the heart out of the cabbage tree and the flax. I ask: ``What is the greatest thing on this earth?'', and the reply will be that it is people, people, people. Kei te tū atu, kei te mihi aroha. Kei te tono atu te aroha o te iwi Māori me ngā iwi katoa o Aotearoa ki ngā iwi o Amerika. Koia tēnei te tū ki te mihi atu ki ngā whānau, ki ngā hapū, ki ngā whāmere kua tau nei te kapua taumaha ki runga i a rātou: te kapua pōuri, te aituā e pā nei ki te iwi o Amerika. Kei te maumahara i te wā tū ai i te taha o ngā hōia i roto i te pakanga tuarua i Hawaiiki nui i roto o Pearl Harbour.

speaker: Rt Hon. WINSTON PETERS
text: A party vote was called for on the question, That the motion as amended be agreed to. Ayes 112 Labour 49; New Zealand National 38;Alliance 10; ACT New Zealand 9; New Zealand First 5;United New Zealand 1. Noes 7 Green Party 7. Majority for: 105 Motion agreed to. BAY OF PLENTY REGIONAL COUNCIL (MAORI CONSTITUENCY EMPOWERING) BILL Third Reading MITA RIRINUI (NZ Labour---Waiāriki): I move, That the Bay of Plenty Regional Council (Maori Constituency Empowering) Bill be now read a third time. Otirā, nā runga i tērā kōrero kai te Kauhautū, ka huri atu au ki te reo rangatira o te motu, kia mihi whānui nei ki ngā mātāwaka mai i te rohe o te Moana-a-Toi kua tae mai ki te Ana o ngā Raeona mai. Nō reira, kei ngā pāpā, kei ngā kuia, kei ngā koroua, kei ngā kuikuia katoa, koutou rā i haramai rā i te nuku o te whenua, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou. Tēnei rā tā koutou māngai kōrero kei Te Ana o ngā Raeona e tū whakaiti nei ki mua i tā koutou aroaro i tēnei hāora, he māngai kōrero mō koutou i ngā āhuatanga rā i kawea mai e koutou mai rā i te nuku o te whenua, mai i te ahu kāinga. Nō reira, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou.

speaker: The ASSISTANT SPEAKER
text: Tēnā koutou kaikawe mai tēnei kaupapa, kia tū rangatira ai ngā iwi o koutou nei pito i runga i te mahakitanga. Nō reira tēnā koutou, kia ora mai tātou katoa.

speaker: Hon. PAREKURA HOROMIA
text: Kua piki te tokomaha o ngā rangatahi e mōhio ana ki te reo. I te nui haere o ngā matua e kōrero Māori ana ki a rātou tamariki me ngā mahi a te kōhanga reo me te kura kaupapa i roto i ngā tau.

speaker: Mita Ririnui
text: ā, ki te Minita, ka pēhea te tautoko a ngā matua Māori i roto i te reo Māori?

speaker: Hon. PAREKURA HOROMIA
text: Ko ngā matua Māori e mōhio ana ki te reo, ka kōrero Māori ki a rātou tamariki ki tōna taumata, ka taea. Ka nui haere te kaha o te kōrerotanga ki runga i te matatau o ngā matua.

speaker: Hon. PAREKURA HOROMIA
text: Kua whakaatu mai ngā hua o tōna hau nei e neke atu i te 70 ōrau ngā Māori e whakarongo ana ki ngā reo irirangi Māori. He rite tonu te whakarongo a te nuinga o ēnei e maha ana rātou ki te nui o te reo oranga nui anei i ngā reo irirangi Māori.

speaker: Owen Jennings
text: He aha tōna āwangawanga nā te nuinga o te iwi Māori kāre i tino matatau ki te kōrero me te tuhituhi i roto i te reo Ingarihi, mēnā kāre e tika ana, nā te aha?

speaker: Hon. PAREKURA HOROMIA
text: E tū ake anō ki te mihi ake anō ki te tangata e mau kaha ake anō ki te matatau ake anō i te reo o te tangata whenua.

speaker: Hon. Parekura Horomia
text: Arrogance will be this Government's undoing. Its members believe their own rhetoric, but New Zealanders do not. Election year 2002---bring it on! Hon. DOVER SAMUELS (NZ Labour---Te Tai Tokerau): Kia ora mai anō tātou katoa. Hoi anō tēnei e tū atu ana ki te mihi ki a koutou katoa mō tēnei kaupapa tino ātaahua whakatakotongia ai e te Pirimia i nānahi nei mō tana matakite te tumanako a te Kāwanatanga mō te iwi puta noa. Koia tēnei te tumanako me te matakite a te Kāwanatanga, kei whakapakari ake te iwi whānui kia tū matarae tātou katoa i raro i ngā kaupapa whakatakotongia ai e te Kawanatanga mō te iwi whānui me te iwi Māori hoki. Ko te whakamāramatanga a te Pirimia e pēnei ana - te rere kē o te kaupapa o tēnei Kāwanatanga i roto āna nei tirohanga me ngā kaupapa e whai ana te āpihana me Te Rōpū Nāhinara ki te motu whānui me te iwi whānui hoki.

speaker: JUDY TURNER
text: Taku mihi tuatahi ki te Runga Rawa nāna i hanga ngā mea katoa. Taku mihi tuarua ki te Whare e tū nei. Te hunga mate kua haere ki muri i te ārai nā rātou i tīmata tēnei huarahi mō tātou, nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā tātou katoa.

speaker: JUDY TURNER
text: What is the most important thing in this world? It is people, people, people. Nō reira, e hoa mā, tātou i huihui mai nei i roto i tēnei o tātou Whare, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora tātou katoa.

speaker: BARBARA STEWART
text: Waiata. Nā reira huri noa ki tēnei Whare, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, ā, kia ora mai anō tātou.

speaker: Mr SPEAKER
text: We of New Zealand First support the mandate that has been set down by the people of Te Uri o Hau. We give our respects and congratulations to the old people, to the descendants of Te Uri o Hau. We give our respects to the children and the grandchildren, the mokopuna, and we hope that as these things go on and negotiations take place, they will be successful and positive, to enable them to get on, move ahead, and achieve the goals they want to achieve. Nō reira, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora. MAHARA OKEROA (NZ Labour--Te Tai Tonga): Ka tū mai ahau i te tuatahi ki te mihi mai i te koroheke me tana wahine i haere mai nei mai i Te Uri o hau i mua o te wahanga kai. Tērā o koutou rā i haere mai nei ki te tautoko i tēnei e pā ana ki tēnei kerēme whenua rā, te kerēmi o Te Uri o hau. Ka mihi mai ki taua tangata Pira kei roto i te Whare Pāremata nei me tana mana me te mana o Te Tai Tokerau katoa koroheke me tana wahine. Tuarua, ko tōku nei mihi ki te Minita, arā, a Margaret Wilson, i a ia e whakakahangia te kaupapa kia puta pea te hua mō rātou rā e noho mai rā i taua pito.

speaker: Hon. DOVER SAMUELS
text: Hūtia te rito o te harakeke, kei hea te kōmako e kō. Whakatairangatia. Rere ki uta, rere ki tai. Ka kī mai koe ki ahau, he aha te mea nui o tēnei ao. Māku kī atu ki a koe, he tangata, he tangata, he tangata e. Take the heart out of the cabbage tree, or the harakeke, where will the bellbird go? Observe the sea and the sky; will it flow with the tides, will it flow to the land? If you were to ask me, ``What is the greatest thing on this Earth?'', let me reply: ``It is people! It is people! It is people!''. Te mea tuatahi māku, kei te mihi atu ki ngā whanaunga o Te Uri o Hau. E ngā whanaunga, ngā maramara tuku iho o Hakiputatomuri, me Haumoewarangi, ā, me ngā maramara hapū o Ngāti Tahuhu, Ngāti Tahinga, Ngāti Rangi, Ngāti Mauku, Ngāti Kauae, Ngāti Kaiwhare, Ngāti Kura, ngā marae o te wā kāinga, Otamatea, Waikaretu, Oruawharo, Araparoa, kei te mihi atu ki a koutou katoa. Kei te mihi atu ki a koutou i roto o te reo karangatia ai tātou i tēnei pō. Kua huihui tātou mō tēnei kaupapa hōhonu mai rā anō tīmata mai i ō tātou mātua tūpuna tae iho ki ēnei rangi, nō reira kei te mihi atu ki a koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Mihi kau ana ki a koe, ki a rātou mā o te motu e rongo ake anō ki te kōrero. Mihi atu anō ki a koe, tēnā koe, tēnā koutou.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Minister of Youth Affairs)
text: I want to pause and pay a special mihi to one of the security officers who died tragically in an accident just before Parliament resumed. E tū te ārai kua whetūrangitia. Tēnei te mihi atu e te rangatira Sam. Moe mai, moe mai a moengaroa. He aroha ki a koutou mō te whānau pani. Kai te mihi, kai te mihi, kai te mihi nunui ki a koutou. Kia kaha, kia toa, kia manawa nui.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Associate Minister of Tourism)
text: Te mea tuatahi māku, kei te mihi atu ki a koe e te Kaiwhakahaere Tuarua o te Whare Pāremata mō tēnei tau hōu, kei te mihi atu ki a koe. Kei te mihi hoki ki ngā mema katoa o tēnei Whare Pāremata, ā, me tēnei Whare tupuna o tātou. I tēnei rā kei te mihi whānui atu ki a koutou katoa, tēna koutou, ā, tēna koutou katoa. Kei te tū tonu tēnei ki te tautoko I ngā kaupapa i pānuitia ai e te Peremia i nanahi nei, ngā kaupapa whakahaere mō te ao whānui, mō to motu o Aotearoa.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Tēnā koe e te Kaiwhakawā, koutou hoki ngā mema o te Whare nei.

speaker: DAVE HEREORA (NZ Labour)
text: E tū ahau ki te mihi ki a tātou, nō reira tēnā koutou.

speaker: MAHARA OKEROA (NZ Labour—Te Tai Tonga)
text: Ko tōku nei tū tuatahi, he mihi aroha atu ki a rātou rā e piupiu ai te rau o te kawakawa, mai i te wā e whaka kapi mai tēnei pouwhare o te motu nei, tae noa mai ki te whakatūwhera anō i tēnei wā i roto, i runga i ngā rā e rua.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Ngā mihi ki a koe; ka mihi ki a koutou ngā mema o te Whare nei.

speaker: BILL GUDGEON (NZ)
text: Kia ora anō tātou i huihui mai nei i roto i tēnei Whare i tēnei pō. Ki ō tatou manuhiri, ki ngā rangatira o Ngāti Ruanui, nau mai, haere mai. Tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: MAHARA OKEROA (NZ Labour—Te Tai Tonga)
text: Ā, tēnā koutou e kui me te rōpū e haere maomao mai, mai raro i tā tāua nei maunga a Taranaki me te tihi o taua maunga. Uhia mai te tīpare rau kawakawa hei tohu nō te mate ki a rātou kua uhia mai i te korowai aroha i a rātou tīmata ai ō rātou nei hīkoi ki te mātātoru, te iti me te rahi, tēnā koutou. Tēnā koutou ō koutou nei maia ki te haramai ki te rongo atu i ngā kōrero kua whakahūātia kei roto i tēnei pouwhare. Kua rongo hoki koutou, kei te tautoko, tino tautoko mai te nuinga o mātou i te tikanga o tēnei pire. Nā, ka maumahara au i tētehi o ngā whakatauākītanga kōrero e whakaputa mai i ō tātou nei poropiti a Te Whiti ki te iwi i a rātou e noho i runga i te marae o Parihaka. Ka mētia e te poropiti ki a rātou ngā rōpū, “E te iwi ka riri mai te hau ki a mātou, ka piko. Ka mutu te riri e te hau ki a mātou, ka tū anō.” Nā, kua tae te wā. Ka tū mana anō koutou, mātou te katoa o ngā iwi o Taranaki i tēnei wā. Kia whakatūtuki pea i ngā auwētanga, i te haehae o te whatumanawa o rātou rā ngā tau heke, ā, kua ngaro ai te katoa. Me kī, me rātou rā e mauherere ai kei roto i ngā āna kei Te Waipounamu. A rātou rā kua mate ai, kua tanumia ai kei te whenua o Te Waipounamu. Nō reira, tēnā tātou.

speaker: METIRIA TUREI (Green)
text: Kia ora koutou katoa. He mihi nui he mihi aroha ki a Ngāti Ruanui, Tangahoe, me Pakakohi.

speaker: MITA RIRINUI (NZ Labour—Waiāriki):
text: Kāti, kia ora hui hui tātou. Taranaki maunga, Taranaki tangata, nau mai, hara mai, tēnā koutou. Tēnā koutou i ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki tō kōtou hara mai rā i te nuku o te whenua i tēnei rā whakahirahira. Hei mātakitaki , hei tirotiro ki ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki tā kōtou pire, nāna nei kua tae atu ki tōna mutunga. Nō reira, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou. Tēnā hoki koutou i ngā āhuatanga kei runga kei a koutou, ngā aituā maha, rātau kāre e tae-ā-tinana mai ana. Otirā, e tū poto noa iho tēnei ki te tautoko i ngā mahi e mahi ana i tō tātou Minita, a Mākareta te Wirihana, ā, me tō tātou Komiti Motuhake mō ngā Take Māori, me te heamana hoki, tā koutou tangata a Mahara Okoroa, ahakoa kei Pōneke e noho ana, kei a koutou tōna ngākau. Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnāhoki tātau.

speaker: MITA RIRINUI (NZ Labour—Waiāriki):
text: I also acknowledge here in the House today representatives of Ngāti Ruanui. As I said: ā, Taranaki tangata, Taranaki maunga ahakoa he maunga titōhea, ka rere ngā manu ki reira unu ai, e kore e mimiti.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Tēnā koe e te Heamana. I mua i te haere tonu o tēnei tū, e mihi kau ana ki a koutou Ngāti Ruanui, nā te mea ko tēnei te wā tuatahi e tū ana au i roto i tēnei kaupapa. Nā reira, koia nei te take e mihi atu ki a koutou. He mihi hoki ki ērā o ngā whanaunga, karanga maha i hinga atu, ā, i tēnei wā ka hoki te mahara ki Maui Prime. Ko ia tētahi i whaka tīmata mai i tēnei kaupapa. Nā reira i te pō nei, kua pūawai. Nā reira, e mihi kau ana ki a rātou.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Kia ora tātou. Kei te mihi atu ki a koe te Kaiwhakahaere ō tēnei wāhanga mō te pire e pā ana ki a tātou te iwi Māori.

speaker: STEVE CHADWICK (NZ Labour—Rotorua)
text: Te Aratuku Whakaata Irirangi Māori Act 2003.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Ā, tēnā koe e te Heamana. Ā, ngā mihi ki a tātou katoa. He mihi hoki ki te tuahine, mai i Tainui mō ōna whakaaro ki te whakahē i te pire nei. Kei te tatari mai i a au i ōna tungāne tokowhā i tautoko mai i tēnei pire. E aha ana te tino pūtake, i tautokongia rātou te āhuatanga o te pire nei nā te mea, kei te whakapae te nuinga o te iwi Māori. Ā, nā te mea kei te whakapae te nuinga o te iwi Māori, kei hea ngā mema Māori o te Kāwanatanga nei i runga tēnei kaupapa? E aha ana te take kei te noho wahangungu i a rātou? Tēnā pea, e tika ana te kōrero o tōku rangatira, a Winitana. He toa rātou i runga i te marae, he rēme i roto i te Whare nei.

speaker: Hon GEORGINA TE HEUHEU (NZ National)
text: Tēnā tātou katoa. Ngā mihi ki a koutou ki te maunga o Taranaki, mai Tongariro, te whare o te Heuheu, tēnā koutou. E mihi nui ki a koutou i tēnei rangi, he rangi nui tēnei. Nō reira, ki a tātou katoa, tēnā tātou katoa.

speaker: Hon TARIANA TURIA (Associate Minister of Māori Affairs (Social Development))
text: Ngāti Ruanui e noho nei ki te whakamana i te kaupapa o tēnei rā, tēnā koutou. Ka nui te tangi ki a koutou e whawhai tonu ana mō ēnei take, tēnā koutou.

speaker: BILL GUDGEON (NZ First)
text: Nō reira, e hoa ma ngā iwi Pākehā kei waenganui i a tātou i tēnei rā ko koutou ngā whanaunga, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora tātou katoa.

speaker: METIRIA TUREI (Green)
text: Tēnā koutou katoa. He mihi nui ki a koe, e te rangatira Pat Heremaia. He mihi aroha nui ki a Tangahoe, Pakakohe, me Ngāti Ruanui.

speaker: MAHARA OKEROA (NZ Labour—Te Tai Tonga)
text: Nā, ka tū ki te mihi anō ki a koutou Aotea waka, Ngāti Ruanui me ngā hapu. Tēnā koutou e haramai nei kei roto i te Whare, ki te rongo atu i ngā kōrero maroke māi i taua tangata, e whaka hōhā mai ki a tātou katoa.

speaker: MITA RIRINUI
text: Kia ora! Otirā, tēnā koutou, Aotea waka, Taranaki tangata, te maunga tītōhea, ngā kārangaranga hapū kei waenganui i a koutou, tēnā koutou nau mai, hara mai. Nā koutou tonu tēnei rā. Ahakoa te iti, te rahi o ngā kōrero, kua hurihuri haere i roto i tēnei Whare, nā koutou tonu te kaupapa. E tautoko ana i ngā mihi o tēnei a tā koutou mokopuna. Nāna e kī, nāna i whakamārama i ngā taimahatanga, i whāwhāhia ai e koutou, mai i ngā rā ki muri, ā, tae noa ki tēnei wā. Otirā, o ngā kōrero maroke o ngā tangata kāre e matatau ana ki a koutou hōhonutanga, tō koutou mamae, me kī rā, he kōrero whakaparanga noa iho tērā. He whakaparanga noa iho nā te mea, ko koutou tonu ngā mea e mārama ana ki a koutou mamae, ā, taimahatanga katoa, e ngā maemaetanga i ūhiatia ai e te Karauna i runga i a koutou mātua, tūpuna i te wā i te pakanga ki roto i a Taranaki. Nō reira, me kī pēnei rā te kōrero, rirerire pai mārire.

speaker: MITA RIRINUI
text: Nā, ehara tēnei i te whakarōroa i te wā e noho ana koutou i roto i tēnei Whare. Kāhore! Kua tutuki ai i ngā kōrero i tā koutou tangata, te maunga i tītōhea kei tōku taha nei, a Mahara. Nāna i kōrero ā-papa ngākau ki a koutou, āna mōhiotanga, i ngā ritenga katoa e pā ana ki a koutou. Kua tū tēnei ki te whakatau atu, ki te whakaoti atu i tēnei wāhanga a tō koutou hīkoi i runga i tēnei huarahi tino roa rawa atu. Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: MITA RIRINUI
text: Ki a koutou katoa, koi nei, kua oti katoa rā ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki tēnei wāhanga o tō koutou pire. Hoki tonu atu ki ō koutou kāinga, ki ngā tini āhuatanga kei waenganui i ngā karanga hapū o Taranaki, ki te mahi i ngā mahi kai mua kai a koutou. Nō reira, me kī anō rā, ngā manaakitanga o Te Runga Rawa ki a koutou. Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora tātou. E tau ana.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: I move, That the Māori Television Service (Te Aratuku Whakaata Irirangi Māori) Bill be now read a third time . E te rangatira whakahaere kōrero, tēnā koe. E aku hoa mema o te Kāwanatanga, me ngā mema o Tērā Tāha, tēnā tātou katoa. I a koutou, Winitana, e mihi ake anō i a koutou. He kaupapa whakahirahira rawa atu tēnei mō ngā iwi Māori katoa o Aotearoa, mō te reo Māori, mō ngā tikanga. Nā reira, he mea nui tonu tēnei ki te whakatakoto i Te Pire Aratuku Whakaata Irirangi Māori kī tēnei Whare mō te pānuitanga tuatoru. Tēnā tātou katoa.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (NZ Labour—Tainui)
text: Ki ahau nei, ahakoa te poto o tōku nei kōrero mō te pire nei, ko tāku nei, ko te wawata mō ngā whakatipuranga hei whakarongo ki tō tātau nei reo, ahakoa torutoru noa iho i te tīmatanga, a te wā ka whakawhānui atu ki tētehi atu, ki te motu whānui kia mōhiotia e rātau te ātaahua o tō tātau nei reo engari, kia mōhio rātau kei te ora tonu, kei te ora tonu mō ake tonu atu. Tēnā koutou. Although mine is just a short contribution, and a bilingual one, it is important that this bill go ahead. At the outset only a small number of people will be exposed to programmes in te reo Māori via this bill, but it is our aspiration that that exposure extend out in time. It can only be good to hear that ours is a living, flourishing language that will live on in all our communities for ever. Nō reira, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora mai tātau katoa.

speaker: PITA PARAONE
text: Madam Chair, I beg your indulgence of my addressing the old people of our Māori community, to let them know the effects of this bill. Nā reira koutou ngā kaumātua, ngā kuikuia e noho tonu ki te wā kāinga, anei te kaupapa o tēnei Kāwanatanga i whakatakoto mai i mua i a tātau i roto i tēnei Whare. Kite koe i ngā inu i inuhia i a koutou ki te whakamahana tā koutou tinana? E hiahia ana tēnei Kāwanatanga kia whakanui te utunga mō ērā o ngā inu. Nā reira, koutou mā, aroha mai ki tēnei tā koutou tamaiti, mokopuna e kōrerohia i tēnei wā nā te mea, kei hea ngā mema Māori, ngā mema nā koutou i whakatohungia he kaīkōrero mā koutou? Ka nui taku aroha i a koutou. Moumou tā koutou tāima ki te tautoko i a rātou. Nā reira, tēnā pea mā te wā ka kite mai i a koutou, ko wai ngā Rōpū e tika ana hei kaikōrero mā koutou. Whakaarongia koutou ki a koutou rangatahi ki te āhuatanga o tēnei pire e hiahia ana te Kāwana kia whakamana, kia whakatau hoki. Mehemea e horekau i wātea ngā inu ki ngā rangatahi i āianei nā, kei te haere tonu i a rātou ki te mau, ki te kai hoki i ngā tarutaru o tēnei ao. Nā reira e tātou mā, koinā noa ngā kōrero mō tēnei wā, engari ka hoki mai i a au i roto i wā tātou reo e rua.

speaker: PITA PARAONE
text: Ahakoa, taihoa, pai atu tēnā tangata ki te kōrero mai i tēnā tū āhua. Engari nā rātau, i tata ake nei, i whakatau tētahi pire ki te whakanui, ki te whakamōhio tātou te iwi whanui te reo Māori. Engari i tenei wā, whakarongo mai i a ia, he kohete mai ki a au, i runga ake i taku tūnga, ki te whakakoretake i wā tātau reo rangatira. Tika atu te āhua i a rātau i tētahi wā, nā rātau i whakamana tā tātau nā reo, engari i tēnei wā, i roto i te kōrero o tēnei kaupapa, nā rātau i whakakoretake tēnei kōrero.

speaker: BILL GUDGEON (NZ First)
text: Te mea tuatahi māku me mihi atu ki ngā manuhiri, Ngāti Tama tēnā koutou i tae mai nei i tēnei pō ki te whakarongo i ngā kōrero, e whakawhitiwhiti ana i roto i tēnei Whare. Nō reira nau mai, haere mai, haere mai. I welcome the people of Ngāti Tama who have come to listen to this bill being discussed in the House tonight. We hope that they will go away with positive thoughts about what is being discussed this evening.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (NZ Labour—Tainui)
text: Tēnei ka tū au ki te tautoko ngā mihi ki ngā mōrehu o Ngāti Tama, tēnā koutou. Ka mihi atu rā ki tō koutou nei maunga a Taranaki, ki ngā kāwai kōrero e pā ana ki ō koutou nei mātua, tūpuna e pā ana ki te whenua. Ko ngā hononga kei waenganui i a mātou nei nō Waikato e pā ana ki ngā whenua i raupatutia, i riro whenua atu, me hoki whenua mai. Nō reira tēnei te mihi atu ki a koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (NZ Labour—Tainui)
text: Nō reira, ko ōku nei kōrero whakamutunga ki ngā mōrehu o Ngāti Tama, ka mihi atu rā ki a koutou i tēnei wā ahakoa ko tēnei te wā tuatahi mo ngā mema katoa o tēnei Whare hei kite i ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki ō koutou nei take. Ka mihi atu rā ki a koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Ā, te mea tuatahi māku, kei te mihi atu ki te whānau o Ngāti Tama e whakaruruhau nei i raro o te maunga tapu o Taranaki, me ngā uri katoa, kei te mihi atu ki a koutou. Kei te maumahara ki ngā tūpuna, ki ngā mātua kua wehe atu ki te pō. Nā rātau nei tēnei kaupapa mai rā anō i tautoko, i poipoi tae noa ki tēnei rā. Nō reira, kia maumahara atu ki a rātau, kore rātau e warewaretia i roto i ā rātau moemoeā, ā, wawata. I am acknowledging the whānau of Ngāti Tama, and also the aspirations of those people who have passed on, in terms of their vision and their hopes that justice would come to their people.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS
text: Nō reira, kei te huri ana ki te mihi ki a koutou ngā whanaunga o Ngāti Tama, te maunga o Taranaki. Tērā, ka whakarongo mai i ngā kōrero tērā o tātou whanaunga i tērā taha o Hikurangi, kei te tautoko atu. Huri ana i tō tātou Whare, mā te Runga Rawa tātou katoa e manaaki. Tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, ā, kia ora mai anō tātou katoa. Kia ora tātou.

speaker: METIRIA TUREI (Green)
text: Ki a koutou katoa, he mihi nui ki a Ngāti Tama, e kui mā, e koro mā me ngā rangatahi katoa, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Tēnei kei te mihi atu ki a koe te Kaiwhakahaere o te Whare. Kei te mihi hoki ki ngāmātua, ki ngāwhāea o ngā tamariki e whakarongo mai ana ki ēneiwhakawhitiwhitikōreroi roto i te Whare Pāremataitēneipō.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Mr Speaker, mihi kau ana ki a koe i roto i te Tūru rā, i a rātau e rongo ake anō ki te kōrero nei ki ngā mema o te Whare Miere nei, tēnā koe.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Minister of Youth Affairs)
text: In that respect, I want to pause and pay a special mihi to one of our VIP drivers who passed away last night—RichardMangu. E te rangatira ki a mātau Richard, e aroha ana ki a koe. Kāre e warewaretia e mātau, me ngā mahi maha ki te awhi i a mātau. Kāre e warewaretia. Nō reira, Richard, moe mai, moe mai i te moenga roa. E te whānau pani, he aroha ki a koutou mai i ngā mema o te Pāremata. E Richard, he aroha. He aroha ki a koutou.

speaker: MAHARA OKEROA (NZ Labour—Te Tai Tonga)
text: Ka tū mai ahau ki te tautoko mai i te mihi poroporoaki ki tētehi o ngā rangatira e tiaki mai i ngā Minita katoa mai rā anō. Ko te tangata rā hoki, hoki atu ki tana kāinga ūkaipō. Ka tū mai ahau ki te mihi mai ki tēnā e tautoko mai i te kōrero o tōku nei hoa a Tamihere. Kei a koe hei whakapākehatia.

speaker: MITA RIRINUI (NZ Labour—Waiāriki)
text: Otirā, te wāhi tuatahi anō tautoko ake ngā mihi ki tō tātou rangatira kua huri ai ki tua o te ārai. Koi rā a Rihari Mangu. Kua hinga atu nei, ā, hoki atu nā ki tōna wā kāinga, tēnei te mihi ake, poroporoaki nei ki a ia.

speaker: MAHARA OKEROA (NZ Labour—Te Tai Tonga)
text: Ā, e te iwi kua whakarongo mai i ngā rarurarutanga o roto i tēnei Whare Pāremata, mai rā anō, kua mōhio koutou i ngā tāngata e whakararuraru i a mātau te iwi Māori. Engari e te iwi, ka tū tonu mātau nei ki te hāpai tika i te kaupapa o tātau katoa. Ngā kaupapa e whakatiaki mai i te reo me ngā mahi o te pouaka tango whakaahua, me ērā atu o ngā taonga o ō koro, a kui mā.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Ā tēnā koe e te Kaiwhakawā, engari i mua i te haere tonu i waku kōrero i te ahiahi nei, he mihi tēnei ki a koutou. Ahau nei, horekau i whakahē wō kōrero e te mema mai i Te Tai Tonga. Engari, māku e mea atu ki a koe, te nuinga o ngā taumahatanga i taka mai kei runga i tō tātou whanaunga a Parekura, ehara i taka ana kei runga ki a ia anahe, engari aua taumahatanga i taka mai kei runga i a tātou ngā mema Māori katoa. Nā reira māku e meatia ki a koutou, kia maumahara ki ngā kōrero o ō tātou matoa, o ō tātou tūpuna, kia tika, kia pono. Mehemea i whakarere kē i a mātau ēnā kupu kōrero, nā, ka puta mai nga hua, ote ra nei mo tonu atu.

speaker: Hon Ken Shirley
text: Does that include Te Māngai Pāho?

speaker: Hon Ken Shirley
text: Waru kāore whakae.

speaker: Hon Tony Ryall
text: Te Māngai Pāho.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Tēnā koe, Mr Speaker, ā, tēnā koutou i tau mai neii te pōnei.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (NZ Labour—Tainui)
text: Tēnā koe, tēnātātau katoa. Ā, ka tū au ki te mihi ki ngā hoa rangapū katoa i roto itēnei Whare Pāremata e pāana ki tēnei take, te mahi pūremu, te mahi kairau. Ā, tuatahi ka tū au ki te hoki ōku mahara ki ngā kupu kōrero o ngāmātua, tūpuna ko te wahine te whare tangata. Ko te wahine te whare kōrero, ko te wahine te whare wānanga. Koinātētehi o ngā tohu rangatira ki a mātaungāwahine, hei tiaki i ō tātaunei tamariki, kia kore, kia kore, kia kore e warewarengātohutohu a koro, a kuimānō te mea, kei a rātaungāwhakatupuranga, kei a rātaungākākano a tōnawā ka puāwai.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Tēnā koe, Mr Speaker, tēnā no tātou.

speaker: Hon Murray McCully
text: Te Māngai Pāho.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Associate Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Ā, ki a koe e te rangatira. E te whanaunga, rangatira, kei te Minita, kei te mihi nunui ki a koe mō tō mahi kei te awhi i a mātau. He iwi kotahi tātou mō ngā motu. No reira, tēnā rā koe. Kai wareware i a mātou mō ngā mema ki tēnei taha, kei te mahi kaha mō ngā kaimahi mō te Tari o Te Puni Kōkiri. No reira, Leith, mō tō rōpu, mō te kaimahi, kai te mihi, kai te mihi, kai te mihi nunui ki a koutou.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (NZ Labour—Tainui)
text: He aha ngaa kaupapa i te Kawanatanga. He tautoko ngaa mahi taapoi Maaori?

speaker: Nanaia Mahuta
text: He aha ētehi o ngā taonga tūturu Māori e pai ana ki ngā manuwhiri tuārangi i tō rātou taunga mai ki Aotearoa?

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS
text: Kei te maha ngā manuhiri e haere mai ana ki te whai i ngā tikanga Māori. Kei te whakamīharo rātou, ngā manuhiri, ki te ātaahua o ngā waiata me ngā mihi whakatau i roto o te reo Māori me te reo o ngā mātua tūpuna. Te tohu tēnei wiki, ko te kōrero i te reo Māori. Many visitors who come to New Zealand come for a Māori cultural experience. They show their appreciation when they are entertained by waiata and mihi of welcome in the Māori language—the language of our tūpuna. It is particularly significant this week to encourage our people to speak in the Māori language—this being Māori Language Week.

speaker: Metiria Turei
text: Kei hea tētahi wāhi marumaru mō te mana whakairo hinengaro me te mana ahurea Māori, kei whakahekea ki te tūranga o te tiki kirihōu?

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS
text: Koia tēnā tētahi a ngā tirohanga a te rīpoata a te Kāwanatanga mō ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki ngā tāpoi Māori e pā ana ki te iwi Māori. Nā, ko tēnā ko tētahi o ngā taonga e kōrero nei i roto o te rīpoata kei te whai i te Kāwanatanga. There is a report from Te Puni Kōkiri in terms of branding Māori and using a standard in terms of the presentation and production of the Māori tourism product right throughout Aotearoa.

speaker: MOANA MACKEY (NZ Labour)
text: “E mahara iho ana, he waka ka urutomo; he ika rere ki Hikurangi rā ia.” Ka maumahara hoki ki aku tīpuna, arā, a Hone rāua ko Wahine, a Elsdon rāua ko Zeta; haere e ngā mate, haere atu koutou i te huanui, i te ara kua papa tauria e te tapuwae kauika tangata. Takoto mai koutou i te urunga e kore nekehia, i te moenga e kore hikitia. Haere, haere, haere, whakaoti atu koutou.

speaker: MOANA MACKEY (NZ Labour)
text: Ki taku iwi a Ngāti Porou, aku mātua a Janet rāua ko Hone, taku tuahine a Erin, taku teina a Tūrei, ngā whanaunga, ngā hoa piripono, ngā mihi nui mō tā koutou tautoko mai i tēnei tamaiti, mokopuna i runga i tēnei huarahi hōu i tēnei rā me ngā rā kei mua. Ki aku hoa mahi hoki o Te Rōpū Reipa, te Pirimia Helen Clark, tēnā koe. He mihi atu tēnei kia koutou katoa. I te ika rere, mai i te tihi o Hikurangi maunga horapa ana ki te ao.

speaker: MOANA MACKEY (NZ Labour)
text: Tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Minister of Youth Affairs)
text: E te Kaihautū, e te whakaruruhau ki a mātau, Ross, tēnā rā koe. E tū ake au ki te mihi nunui ki a koe e te rangatira Russell, nō reira, i tua o te ārai kua whetūrangitia, tēnei i mihi atu mō te tamaiti kōrua. Ā, moe mai, moe mai i te moenga roa, te uri a Russell. Nō reira, aroha ki a koutou. Mō te whānau pani, kia kaha, kia toa, kia manawa nui.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Minister of Youth Affairs)
text: E te kaihautū me te whakaruruhau, tēnārā koe. Ngā mihi nunui ki te whānui o te motu, kei te mihi nunui ki a koutou. Taku īnoi ki a koutou—e aroha ki a koe, Georgina, aroha ki a koe, aroha ki a koe. Mōhio ki a mātou, aroha ki a koutou. Nō reira, ki a koutou mā, taku īnoi e ngā iwi whānui kia mau te kaupapa nunui, te kaupapa tūturumōrātoungātīpuna. Te mana motuhake mōmātou. Katia te pitomō te Kāwanatanga. Engari, e tūake au ki te tautoko te mana whenua, te mana mōngā iwi, kotahi tātoumō te whenua o Aotearoa. Kārerātoungātīpuna e warewaretia e mātau. Takototonu, takototonu, ā, takototonu.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Ki a koe te Kaiwhakahaere o te Whare nei, e tika ake anō i runga anō o te tū nei ki te mihi anō i a koe, tēnā koe. Nā te mea e mōhio anake anō tātou te tō roa noa iho o te tae ake o te tuhinga nei, o te pire nei ki roto iI te Whare nei, e mihi kau ana ki a rātou kāre i konei. Ka mihi anō hoki ki a rātou ngā kaiwhakahaere o te kōmihana, e mau kaha ake anō mō tēnei tino kaupapa, tēnā koutou.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Kī ake anō ki te mihi ake anō ki ōku hoa mahi i konei o te Kāwana me koutou ngā kanohi Māori. Tō tātau pakeke e Winitana, koutou katoa mihi ake anō i a koe, tēnā koe.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Associate Minister of Maori Affairs)
text: E tū ake au kei te tautoko e te mihi i mihia e te whanaunga me te Minita Māori, i te kōmihana, nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou. Kei te tautoko i te mihi i mihiaina mō te kaimahi, mō te kōmihana, aroha ki a koutou.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: E mihi kau ana ki a tātou katoa mai i te motu, i a koutou e rongo ake anō i rō Whare, e mihi kau ana i a koutou.Ngā kanohi Māori o tērā tino rā i puta, e mihi kau ana, tēnā koutou.

speaker: Pita Paraone
text: Kura kaupapa Māori.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Ā, tēnā koe Madam Speaker, ā, tēnā anō koe, arā, tātou katoa mō te tau hōu nei. Tēnei te tau e ki nei wā tātou whanaunga hōu mai i Haina, te tau mō ngā makimaki.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Ā, te wāhanga tuatahi kua hōmaingia ki ahau mō tēnei wā o te Whare Pāremata nā te mea koia nei tēnei te wāhanga tuatahi hei tūtanga hei kōrero māku, ā, kei te mihi atu ki a koe kei te Kaikōrero o te Whare, Mr Assistant Speaker.Kei te mihi whānui hoki katoa ki ngā mema katoa o te Whare Pāremata. Ko te tumanako kia pai te tau hōu kei te haere mai.Nō reira huri ana, tēnā koutou, ā, kia ora mai anō tātou koutou.

speaker: DAVE HEREORA (Labour)
text: E tū ana ahau ki te mihi nui ki a tātou kei roto i tēnei Whare Pāremata.Nō reira, tēnā rā tātou katoa.

speaker: MAHARA OKEROA (Labour—Te Tai Tonga)
text: Ā, ka tū tēnei tū tuatahi kei mua i a koe, ka tukuna atu he mihi rangatira ki a koe i a koe e noho mai i runga i te tūnga Kaiwhakawā o te Whare Pāremata nei. Mr Speaker, I begin my presentation by making reference to the office you hold in this House, and the acknowledgment we pay to you and your kuia. Tēnā koe.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA
text: Kāre e tika e tū ake anō au i te whai takahia mō rātou mai i te motu. E tika ake anō tō rātou whakaaro. Kāre ki a koe e taea ki te pātai ki a wau he aha kē tōkū whakaaro mō tērā tino kōrero o ngā rangatira mai i te motu.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Associate Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Mr Speaker, e aroha ana ki a koe e te rangatira, te whakaruruhau i a mātau. Ā, kei te mihi nunui ki a koutou mō ngā iwi whānui i waho mō te Pāremata. He aroha ki a koutou i waho. Mōhio ki a koutou e te iwi whānui e tū ake au mō te mema Māori kei te tautoko te Rōpū Reipā, ā, pai koinā. Nō reira, kaua e wareware ki a mātou te tīpuna ratou, ā, takoto tonu, takoto tonu, ā takoto tonu.

speaker: Rt Hon WINSTON PETERS (Leader—NZ First)
text: Ngā reo, ngā mana, ngā waka, ngāpūkōrero o ngā hau e whā, rau rangatira mā, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: E tikaakeanōi te mihi akeanō ki a koutou o te hau kāinga, te mana whenua, i a koutou mai i te motui tae akeanōi roto i te āhua o te hīkoi. Tēnā koutou.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (Labour—Tainui)
text: Mōkau ki runga, Tāmaki ki raro, ko Mangatoatoa kei waenganui. Ko Pare Hauraki, ko Pare Waikato te kaokaoroa o Pātetere. Ka huri te titiro ki te rāwhiti, ko Tīkapa Moana Te Pae o Hauraki ki Moehau. Ka rere atu au ki ngā tai mihia o te Waitematā, ki te mānukanuka o Hoturoa. Tiro atu au ki te pūaha o te awa Tūpuna, he piko, he taniwha, Waikato taniwharau. Ka rongo te whatitiri. Tainui Āwhiro e ngunguruanai te ao, i te pō. Ka tae atu rā ki te tumu o te waka ki Kāwhia tangata, ki Aotea whenua, Whaingaroa te moana. Ka tau hoki te ūnga o te waka ki Mōkau. Kāti au ikonei. Pai mārire!

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (Labour—Tainui)
text: Nō reira, he hokingamahara, e kore tēneioranga e huri ki tua o āku mokopuna.Tēnei e tūnei, e hariaana ō koutou wawata ā koro, ā kuimā, ki te whakahēitēneipire.Ka huri.

speaker: TARIANA TURIA (Labour—Te Tai Hauāuru)
text: E ngā mana, e ngā reo, tēnā koutou katoa. E ngā tangata whenua o Aotearoa kuamarangaakei te karanga o te takutai moana, maranga mai, maranga mai.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Associate Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Ko Hikurangitōku maunga e kore rā e nekeneke. Ko Waiapūtaku awa e rere rā. Ko Porourangi te tangata. Ko Te Aitanga-ā-Mate me Te Whānau-ā-Rua ngāhapū. Ko Harataunga me Mataorangā whenua. KōNgātiPorouWhānui-ki-Hauraki te iwi. Tihei mauri ora!

speaker: MAHARA OKEROA (Labour—Te Tai Tonga)
text: Kia ora Mr Speaker. Tēnā koutou katoa i haere mai nei ki te rongo au. Ko te whānuitia o ngākōrero, ko au he uri nō Te Raukura. Tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora mai tātau katoa.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: E Te RōpūKaihīkoi, ā, kei te mihi atu ki a koutou katoa. Ā, irungai te huarahi, ā, hoki atu koutou ki ō koutou wākāingamā. Te RungaRawa koutou e manaaki. Ngākaumātua, ngākuikuia, ā, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnāanō hoki tātou katoa.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Koutou ngā kanohi Māorii roto i te Whare nei, e mihi kauana ki a koutou katoa. I a rātoukāre kei te ora, i a rātou e haere akeanō, e mihi kauana ki a rātou katoa.

speaker: DAVE HEREORA (Labour)
text: Ā, kia ora Mr Speaker. E tū ahau ki te mihi nui ki a tātou o ngā tāngata kei runga i tēnei Whare Pāremata; nō reira tēnā koutou, ā, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: MAHARA OKEROA (Labour—Te Tai Tonga)
text: Ā, tēnā koe, Madam Speaker, i a koe e whakahaeretia i ngā āhuatanga o te Whare nei.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Ā, tēnā koe, Mr Speaker. Kei te mihi atu ki a koe, arā, kei te pānui atu ki te ao Māorimōngā kaupapa e pāana ki a rātou, arā, ngā kaupapa hoki a Te RōpūNāhinara e whaineirātou ki te murungāmāngaiMāori katoa i roto i te Whare Pāremata.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Ā, tēnā koe. Te meatuatahimāku ki te mihi atu ki te iwi Māori, te ao Māori e whakarongo mai ana ki ēneikōrero. Kore rawatēneiKāwanatanga e tautoko i te pire a Rodney Hide.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Ā, tēnā koe e te Kaiwhakawā, koutou hoki e whakarongo mai ki tēnei o ngākōrero.Kei te tautoko ngā mihi, i mihi atu tēnā o tātou mema mai i Te Tai Tokerau.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Madam Speaker, tēnā koe. Ko tēneianō Te Wiki o te Reo Māori. E tikaakeanō I runga I te tūnei ki te mihi akeanō I ā tātou mai I te motu, kei te whawhaitonuakeanōmōtōtātou reo. E mōhioakeanōtātou, ko tēneianō te reo o te tangata whenua o Aotearoa. I nui akeanōngā tamariki e whai kaha I roto o ngā kura, ngākōhangapērātonu.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Ko te meatuatahimāku, kei te mihi atu ki a koe te WhaeaKaiwhakahaere o te Whare, ā, me ngā mema katoa. I acknowledge Madam Speaker, and also members of the House.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Kei te tū atu ki te tautoko I tēneiwiki, arā, tumanako kia whakaatungia te reo Māori ki te motu katoa. I stand up to support Māori Language Week.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Ko te tumanako, ko te wero ki a tātoungā mema o te Whare Pāremata kia kōrero Māori tātou I ngāwā katoa. Pēnāwharakautātau e mohioana ki te kōrero Māori, me haere ētahi o tātau ki te kōhanga reo. I invite our colleagues and all members of Parliament to take up the challenge and learn the Māori language. Perhaps I could help them by advising them to start off with kōhanga reo.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (Labour—Tainui)
text: Ka pewhea te Kāwanatanga i tautoko i te reo Māori i roto i ngā kainga? How has the Government promoted the use of Māori language in homes?

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: I tukuna e tēnei Kāwanatanga he tautoko hei whakatairanga i te kōrerotanga o te reo Māori i ngā kāinga o te motu, arā, ko ngā mahi pāho, ko ngā mahi hoki pēnei i te Wiki o te Reo Māori.

speaker: Nanaia Mahuta
text: He aha i noho ai ko te tautoko i te kōrerotanga o te reo Māori, he kaupapa nui hei whai mō te Kāwanatanga?

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS
text: Nā te tautoko a tēnei Kāwanatanga mō Te Wiki o te Reo Māori, kua noho tēnei te tino kaupapa nui o te tau.I te tīmatanga o tēnei tau, ka whakaterehia te pouaka whakaata Māori. E toru rau rima tekau mano ki te mātakitaki mai o ngā iwi katoa whānui o Aotearoa.

speaker: Pita Paraone
text: Āwhea te Kāwanatanga e tautoko i te reo Māori, mai i te tahi wiki ia tau, ki te rima tekau mā rua wiki ia tau?

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS
text: Kei te tautoko te Kāwanatanga ki te kōrero i te reo Māori i ngā tau katoa, i ngā tau katoa.Tēnei wiki, he wiki whakanui whakarongo mai i te motu mō tēnei wiki anake engari, harakau te Kāwanatanga e tohu ana ko tēnei wiki anake engari, harakau te Kāwanatanga e tohu ana ko tēnei wiki anake engari ki te tautoko i ngā tau haere mai katoa. A, nā tērā kua tohungia tātau katoa he iwi Māori, tangata whenua tātau katoa, arā, indigenous New Zealanders.

speaker: Metiria Turei
text: Ka pēwhea te Kāwanatanga i tautoko i te reo Māori i roto i te Whare Pāremata, ā, mō ngā mema Pāremata?

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS
text: Ko te tumanako a te Kāwanatanga, kia akotia ngā mema katoa o te Whare Pāremata ki te kōrero i te reo Māori, arā, pēnā e harakau e mōhio ana ngā mema o te Kākāriki ki te kōrero Māori, āku nei pātai ki a rātau, āku nei tohu ki a rātau, me haere rātau ki te kōhanga reo.

speaker: Nanaia Mahuta
text: Ko ngā reo irirangi me te pouaka whakaata e whakapāho atu o tātau nei reo kei waenganui i ō tātau nei whānau, ki ōu whakaaro, kei te haere tonu tēnei āhuatanga, kei waenganui i ō tātau nei whānau?

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS
text: Nā te mea, ngā kāinga katoa puta noa i te motu mātakitaki mai ana i te pouaka whakaata, e whakarongo ana ngā taringa ki te reo irirangi, ā, kei te tautoko atu ēnei kaupapa kia whakarongo mai ai te iwi whānui puta noa i te motu, ngā āhuatanga e pā ana ki te reo, ā, me te tūmanako hoki, kia haere rātou ki te whai ngā āhuatanga mō te reo Māori.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Labour—Ikaroa-Rawhiti)
text: I move, That the Te Runanga o Ngati Awa Bill be now read a first time. E tikaakeanōi roto i te tūnei ki te mihi akeanōi a koutou o Ngāti Awa mōtōrātou kaha i te tae kaha akeanōitēneiwā, e whakatū hoki akeanō te āhuanei o te kaupapa.

speaker: Hon GEORGINA TE HEUHEU (National)
text: Tēnātātou katoa. Tēnākōutoutōkuwhānaukua tae mai. He mihi aroha, mai i te whare o te Heuheu itēneirāwhakahirahira. Nō reira, tēnātātou katoa.

speaker: BILL GUDGEON (NZ First)
text: Nō reira, kuamutuneiōkuneikōrero. I have come to the end of my speech today. Ki a koutou, ki a koe e te Minita, tēnā koe e awhi mai nei koe ō mātou whanaunga o Ngāti Awa.

speaker: BILL GUDGEON (NZ First)
text: Tēnā koutou Ngāti Awa e noho mai nāirunganā. E hari, e koaana te ngākaukuawhiwhi koutou ētahi o ngā taonga ingāro. Tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, kia ora tātou katoa.

speaker: NANDOR TANCZOS (Green)
text: Tēnā koutou ngā mihi nui ki ngāhapū katoa, me ngāwhānau hoki o Ngāti Awa. I give greetings to all of the people of Ngāti Awa.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (Labour—Tainui)
text: Tēnātātou katoa. Tuatahitēneiahau e mihi kauana ki ngāmōrehu o Ngāti Awa, koutou ko ngātini mate e pīkaunei e koutou irungai ō koutou neipokohiwa, e kaweanei e rātaui roto itēnei Whare, tēnā koutou. Ki a tātau, tēnātātau katoa.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (Labour—Tainui)
text: It is important at the first reading of this bill to remind members of the House of the statutory pardon that is in this Bill. It reads: “He panuitenei ki te motu katoa, ka tutukianatenei Ture, koinei te wa e whakahokiaai ki a ratou te ihi, te mana, te tapu o nga tangata o Ngati Awa imauhereheretia, iwhakawakiai te tau 1865, ki o ratouwhanau hoki, ki o ratou iwi, tae atu ki a Ngati Awa whanui. Ka wetekinakatoatiangawhiu o te ture i pa ki a ratoui roto ingapakanga whenua o Te Tau 1865.”

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Labour—Ikaroa-Rawhiti)
text: E tūakeanō au ki te mihi akeanōi a koutou, Hirini, ngātūpakeke o te wāhii a koutou e tae kaha akeanōikoneiitūimuai te kaupapa, e Joe, koutou e Hune, koutou katoa, tēnā koutou.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: E tika ake anō i runga i te tū nei ki te mihi ake anō ki a rātou o Ngāti Awa e tae ake anō i konei.Ngā mea pakeke pērā i a koutou e Hirini, e Joe, ngā kuia, ngā koroua merātau kāre i konei, kāre e tae. Kua haere ake anō ki tērā wāhi e mōhio ake anō tātau kei te mau mahara ake anō ngā tupuna.Tēnā tātau.

speaker: BILL GUDGEON (NZ First)
text: Ā, tēnā anō tātau e huihui mai nei i roto i tēnei o ō tātau Whare i tēnei ahiahi. Tēnā koutou Ngāti Awa kua tae mai ā-tinana mai nei ki te whakarongo ki ngā kōrero e whakawhitiwhitia ana i roto i tēnei o ō tātau Whare.

speaker: METIRIA TUREI (Green)
text: Kia ora koutou katoa! Te manuhiri tūārangi, ngā kaumātua, ngā rangatira, ngā tungāne, ngā tuākana koutou o Ngāti Awa kua tae tautoko mai i tēnei ahiahi, nau mai, haere mai, whakatau mai. Tēnā hoki koutou me te huhua o ō tātou mate, e kore e taea e tātau te aukatia, haere e ngā mate.Kua whakanaumaihia e ēnā o ō tātau mātua tūpuna.Ē kī ana te kōrero, oti atu te pō, nau mai te ao.Huri noa i tō tātau piringa nei e tū kaha nei, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa .

speaker: MITA RIRINUI (Labour—Waiariki)
text: Otirā, tēnā koe kai te Kaihautū o te Whare nei. Ā, tēnā kōtou o Ngāti Awa, kōutou i haere tawhiti mai, mai i te hau kāinga, mai i Te Moana-a-Toi-te-Huatahi, mai i Te Mānuka Tuatahi, tēnā kōtou, tēnā kōtou, tēnā kōtou. Tēnā kōtou te āhuatanga o te kaupapa kei runga kei te tēpu i tēnei wā. Nā kōutou i kawe mai rā i te nuku o te whenua, kia whakamanahia i roto i te ture, e tutuki ai, e oti ai ngā taimahatanga o te ao tawhito i waenganui i a kōtou. Nō reira, nā kōtou hoki te kaupapa o te rā nō reira, nau mai, hara mai.

speaker: MITA RIRINUI (Labour—Waiariki)
text: Kai te Kaihautū, kaua e pāpōuri mai, ko te hiahia tonu au ki te tū, ki te kōrero ki roto i te reo rangatira ki taku iwi ki a Ngāti Awa. Kua kōrerohia ngā kōrero i roto i te Whare nei.Ko wētahi kua kauhautia ētahi kōrero ki a koutou, ko wētahi kua tohutohungia hoki ō rātou kōrero ki a kōtou te āhua nei ka tau mai kōtou ehara he rangatira, engari he tamariki tonu.Nō reira, koia nā hoki au e whakahē atu ki a rātau nā rātau ēnei kōrero i whakaputa. Ā, ko tēnei mea te utu mō te wairuatanga he kōrero kūware noa iho tēnā.Nō reira, kaua kōtou e pāpōuri mai ki tēnei kōrero, koia nei ngā tino mate o tēnei Whare.Nō reira, tēnā kōtou, tēnā kōtou, tēnā kōtou.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Associate Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: E te Kaihautū, te whakaruruhau ki a mātau, Jonathan, tēnā rā koe. E ngā tuāhine, tuākana i roto i te Whare Pāremata, kei te mihi nunui ki a koutou. Nō reira e te rangatira mō ngā hapū o Ngāti Awa, kei te mihi nunui ki a koutou. Kei te tautoko i te mihimihi a Mita rāua ko Parekura, kei te mihi nunui ki a koutou. Kei te tautoko i te mihimihi, ā, he tipuna rātau. Nō reira koutou mā, tēnā koutou kia ora huihui mai anō rā tātau katoa.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Te mea tuatahi māku, he mihi atu ki a koe te Kaiwhakahaere o te Whare i tēnei pō.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Te mea tuatahi māku, he mihi atu ki te komihana o Te Ohu Kai Moana me ngā kaiwhakahaere katoa nā rātau nei tēnei kaupapa i whakahoki mai ki mua i te aroaro o te Whare Pāremata. Kei te mihi hoki ki a rātou mā kua huri atu ki muri i te ārai.Kei te maumahara atu ki tērā o wā tātou rangatira a Matiu Rata.Koia tētahi o ngā kaipoipoi o tēnei kaupapa mai rā anō.Ko rātau kua moe, kua puāwai, kua puta ngā hua o ā rātou kaupapa whakaaro, moemoeā. Ki ngā whānau, ki ngā hapū, ki ngā iwi hoki nā rātau tēnei kaupapa mai rā anō te tārewatanga mō te 12 tau, kua puāwai ō rātau moemoeā i roto i tēnei pire i tēnei pō.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Nō reira, kei te mihi atu ki a koutou katoa ngā mema o tō mātou komiti, te kaiwhakahaere o te komiti whakatau i tēnei kaupapa, tēnā koutou, ā, tēnā koutou.Kia ora mai anō tātou katoa. Kia ora tātou.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Ko te tikanga kia tīmata mai aku kōrero i roto i tō tātau reo rangatira nā te mea, tuatahi, he kaupapa tēnei e pā ana ki a ngāi tātau te iwi Māori, tuarua, nā te mahinga hī ika, ā, tuatoru, nā te iwi whānui o Aotearoa.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: E tikaakeanō ki te mihi akeanō ki a koutou o te kōmihana, i a koutou mai i te motui tae akeanō ki te rongoakeanō ki te whakaotinga o tēneipire. I a kōruaanō e Doug me a koe Koro, e mihi kauanai a kōrua e tae kaha akeanōikonei.

speaker: Hon JOHN TAMIHERE (Associate Minister of Maori Affairs)
text: E te Kaihautū, te kaiwhakaruruhaui a mātou Jonathan, tēnārā koe. E ngā rangatira, mātua, Koro rāua ko Doug, ā, tēnārākōrua, tēnārākōrua, tēnārākōrua. Nō reira, e ngārau rangatira rongonui o te kōmihana, e ngā iwi hurinoa, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa. Ā, kei te tautoko, kei te whakamiha ki a rātoungātīpuna. E te rangatira a Pari, e rātoumāngātīpuna, haere, haere, haere ki a koutou.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Labour—Te Tai Tokerau)
text: Ā, tēnā koe, Mr Speaker. Te meatuatahimāku, kei te mihi atu ki ngākaumātua e noho mai rā, e Koro, e Doug Kidd, e Graham. Kei te mihi atu ki a koutou katoa mōtēneirā tino nui rawa atu mō te iwi Māori.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Labour—Te Tai Tokerau)
text: Nā reira, tū atu ana ki konei ki tēnei o ngā whare ki te mihi whānui atu ki a koutou katoa. Whakarongo mai te iwi Māori, ko tēnei te rāwhakahirahira, whakanuiputanoaitōtātoumotu. Huriana, tēnā koutou, ā, tēnā koutou, kia ora mai anōtātou katoa. Kia ora tātou.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (Labour—Tainui)
text: Ā, e kore e mutungā mihi ki a rātoumākuahuri ki tua o te ārai, heke iho mai ki a tātou e huihui mai neiitēneirangi, ā, tēnātātoukatou.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (Labour—Tainui)
text: He iti anōtākumōtēnei kaupapa kei muai a tātouitēneiwā, nō reira, tēnātātou katoa.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Tēnā koe e te Heamana. Ā, tēnārātātou e noho tahi anai roto i te Whare i te rānei. E tūakeanatēnei ki te tautoko ingāwhakaaro o taku hoa o mātoui roto o Aotearoa Tuatahi, a Barbara Stewart.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Ā, tēnā koe Madam Speaker. Ā, tēnā hoki ngā mema o tēnā taha, koutou ngā mema Māorii roto i te Kāwanatanga. Engari, he tūwāhipototēnei ki te mihi atu ki a koutou o NgātiTūwharetoa, e kara ma, e Bob, koutou ngātuāhine, ngāwhaea hoki, ā, tēnā koutou.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Nā reira, ka nui rawa atu ngā mihi ki a koutou NgātiTūwharetoamōtēnāwhakaaro.Ehara he whakaaromā koutou nahe, engarimō te iwi whānuii roto i a tātou o Aotearoa.

speaker: METIRIA TUREI (Green)
text: E te manuhiri tūārangi, ngākaumātua, ngā rangatira o NgātiTūwharetoa ki Kawerau kua tae tautoko mai itēneiahiahi, nau mai, haere mai, whakatau mai.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: Tihei mauri ora! Ki a koutou katoa e tae akeanōi te rongo, e Paora, koutou katoa, e mihi kauana, tēnā koutou. E ngāmātāwaka ā-iwi, ā-whānau, ā-hapū hoki tēnā koutou. Kaua koutou e māharahara, e āwangawangarāneimō ō koutou mana, nārangatiratanga hoki nō te mea, kāreēnei e muruairaroi te Pire o te Takutai Moana. Ka mautonuēnei mana mōaketonu. Mātēneipireinā ka whakamanatia e tiaki ō tātau mana tipuna ki ngātakutai moana. Ahakoanoatēneipire kei te wātea te huarahi ki te kōrero tahi mai te Karauna. Kia ora tātou katoa.

speaker: JOHN TAMIHERE (Labour—TamakiMakaurau)
text: Kia ora huihui mai rātātau katoa. E te kaihautū me te whakaruruhau ki a mātautēnārā koe, Clem.

speaker: BILL GUDGEON (NZ First)
text: Tēnā anō tātou katoa i huihui mai nei i roto i tēnei o ō tātou whare. Greetings to all of us who are gathered here today.

speaker: EDWIN PERRY (NZ First)
text: Te tiamana o Ngāti Kahungunu iwi, nau mai, haere mai, tēnā koe, tēnā koe, tēnā koe.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Maori Affairs)
text: E tikaakeanō ki te mihi akeanōi a rātau e tae akeanōikonei, ngā kanohi Māori, mai i te motu.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (Labour—Tainui)
text: Ā, tuatahi, he mihi maioha ki te koroheke e takoto mai anai te marae kei Tūrangawaewae. Takoto e koro, moe mai, okioki.

speaker: NANAIA MAHUTA (Labour—Tainui)
text: Nō reira, ko ngākōrerowhakamutunga mai itōkutūpuna a Mahutai te wāikonei ia, “I haere Māori atu, i hoki Māori mai.” Anā, i te mutunga, ka hoki katoa tātou ki te kāinga. Ka mutu. Kia ora.

speaker: MAHARA OKEROA (Labour—Te Tai Tonga)
text: Tuatahi kei te kōpikopikoai te māhunga o tēneinā te tamaiti o Parihaka ki te tihi o Maunga Taupiri e raukawakawaana, e piuaai e ngā hau e whā.

speaker: TARIANA TURIA (Leader—Māori Party)
text: Nō reira, ka nui te mihi ki a koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā tātou katoa.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Ā, tēnā koe, Mr Speaker. Ngā mihi o te tau hōu ki a koe. E tū atu ana ki te tautoko i te pānui a te Pirimia ki te Whare i tēnei rā me āna nei tautoko, mihi hoki ki te whānau o ĀhiaKei te tautoko i āna nei mihi aroha ki te taupuketanga o te ngaru nui i te moana o Āhia ki runga i ngā whenua o tāwāhi. Kei te tautoko atu i ngā mihi aroha ki a rātou katoa. Moe mai, haere atu, haere, haere koutou.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS
text: Nō reira, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Ā, tēnā koe, Mr Speaker, me ngā mema katoa o te Whare nei, ahakoa tēhea tō rōpū.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: I stand on behalf of New Zealand First to speak to the Ngaa Rauru Kiitahi Claims Settlement Bill. But , i mua i te haere tonu o tēnei o tātou tūnga, he wāhi poto tēnei ki te mihi atu ki a koutou kua tae mai i tēnā pito i raro o te maunga tapu o Taranaki. Arā, koutou o Ngā Rauru Kītahi. Koutou i haere mai ki te kite i te whakaurunga mai i te pire, arā, kia turengia tā koutou kerēme whakataunga i raro o te Tiriti o Waitangi.

speaker: Hon MITA RIRINUI (Minister of State)
text: Ā, kai te maunga Tītōhia, tēnā koutou. Tēnā koutou i haere tawhiti mai i te mata o te whenua nā runga i te kaupapa o te rā, kia whakatutukihia hoki tēnei kerēme o koutou. Nā runga i taua kōrero, kua hoki mai rā te kāwanatanga ki tana ūkaipō, kia whakatutukihia hoki ngā taimahatanga kai runga kai a koutou kia watea ai te huarahi ki mua. Nō reira tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: METIRIA TUREI (Green)
text: E te manuhiri tūārangi, ngā kaumātua, ngā rangatira, ngā tungāne, ngā tuākana, koutou o Ngā Rauru Kītahi kua tae mai ki te tautoko i tēnei ahiahi, nau mai, haere mai, whakatau mai.

speaker: Hon DOVER SAMUELS (Minister of State)
text: Ā, te mea tuatahi māku ki te mihi atu ki te rūnanga me ngā whanaunga o Ngāti Awa mō tēnei rā whakatau i tā koutou pire, te pire o te rūnanga. Kei te mihi atu nōki ki ngā kaiwhakawā o te pire i runga o te Komiti Māori o te Whare Pāremata.

speaker: PITA PARAONE (NZ First)
text: Ā, tēnā koe Madam Chair, ā, tēnā hoki tātou o te Whare. Ngā mihi hoki ki ngā māngai o Ngāti Awa, ahakoa horekau rātau i waenganui i a tātau ā-tinana, ā, tēnā koutou e kara mā. Tēnei tā koutou teina mai i te waka o Mātaatua, e tika ana kia mihi atu ki a koutou.

speaker: Hon MITA RIRINUI (Minister of State)
text: Ā, tēnā koutou kai Te Mānuku Tūtahi, nau mai, hara mai.

speaker: Hon PAREKURA HOROMIA (Minister of Māori Affairs)
text: E tika ake anō ki te mihi ake anō i a koutou i konei ki te tautoko i muri a te pire nei.

speaker: JIM PETERS (NZ First)
text: Tēnā koe Mr Speaker. Ngā rangatira, ngā kaikawe o tēnei kaupapa mō Ngāti Awa, tēnā koutou, tēnā koutou katoa.

speaker: JOHN TAMIHERE (Labour—Tamaki Makaurau)
text: E ngā rau rangatira mā, e kui mā, tuahine mā, tuakana mā i raro i te maru o te tipuna rongonui a Awanuiārangi i Ngāti Awa. Kei te mihi, kei te mihi, kei te mihi nunui ki a koutou. Kāre e wareware ki a mātou te mahi kaha mō ngā tīpuna ki a koutou. Kei te mihi nunui mō ngā tīpuna. Te mahi kaha ki te awhi, ki te hari i te manaaki mō ngā iwi kotahi tātou a Ngāti Awa. Haere, haere, haere atu rā.

speaker: GERRY BROWNLEE
text: I raise a point of order, Mr Chairperson. I have in front of me Supplementary Order Paper 327. Its salient point is a provision that states: “I te rangi tuawaru o te marama o Hurae ka whakaretangia e te Karauna me Ngāti Awa he Whakaaetanga o Nga Whakataunga.
